loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 26-year-old married woman from a small village called Tammoun near Nablus. Abeer's husband is employed and receives a low salary which is not enough to cover all his needs. Their house was partially damaged because of the rain this winter.

Abeer wants to fix her house, so she is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover this cost. Taking this loan will help Abeer and her husband have better living conditions and enable them to enjoy living in their house.

Abeer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of fixing her home.

loans.name: Jesus Esta Aqui 3 Group

texts.en:
Hilover is the coordinator of the group, Jesus está Aquí (Jesus is Here) 3. This group is located in the slums that ring the capital city. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Hilover is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling tennis shoes, by purchasing pairs of tennis shoes to sell in her community. She will use the profits to finish building her home and saving toward the university education of her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ilian

texts.es: Ilian de 42 años de edad es la propietaria de una peluquería ubicada en su domicilio donde habita con su cónyuge y su hijo  de 25 años. Desde hace 15 años Ilian inició su negocio, dando curso a su espíritu emprendedor y a la experiencia adquirida de su madre, pues también es peluquera. Ella ofrece en su negocio mejoramiento de la imagen personal, mediante tratamientos capilares, peinados, alisado corte, tintura de cabello, manicure y pedicure. Su día de trabajo inicia desde las 7 de la mañana y termina a las 9 de la noche, todos los días y si es necesario los fines de semana y festivos en temporadas especiales trabaja mucho mas. Su meta más adelante es lograr que su hijo  termine su carrera profesional y sea muy exitoso. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva primer financiemiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una silla de peluquería, espejo e insumos de belleza, con ello acondicionará su local y llamará la atención de su clientela, que no solo encuentran en la sala de belleza de Ilian, un servicio de buena calidad sino también un ambiente confortable y por eso regresan. Esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva se perfile como una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Ilian, 42 years old, is the owner of beauty salon located in her home, where she lives with her husband and 25-year-old son. Fifteen years ago, Ilain opened her business, led by her entrepreneurial spirit and training from her mother, who also owns a beauty salon. Ilian helps her clients improve their personal image through hair treatments and styling services such as straightening, haircuts, color treatments, manicures and pedicures. She works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. on weekdays as well as on weekends and holidays in the seasons where business is thriving.

Ilian's goal for the future is to see her son finish studying a professional career and be successful. Currently, she is requesting her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy a styling chair, mirror, and beauty products to set up her shop and attract customers. She wants to make sure her clients find her salon a comfortable place with excellent service so that they return. This is exactly what makes her Kiva loan a good investment.

loans.use: to buy a styling chair, mirror, and beauty products.

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is a 41-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes and green peppers, to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Mele has requested a loan to buy weed spray, weed killer, snail chemicals, a pair of gloves, a hose and a wheelbarrow for her agricultural business. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011. With her profits, Mele hopes to improve her business to earn even more profits and help her in her family matters.

loans.use: to purchase items such as weed spray, weed killer, gloves and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 45 years old and married with five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, bags, sugar, baking powder, a large tin bowl and a gas oven. In the future, Lina hopes to earn more profit to improve her business and help her educate her children. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, baking powder and a gas oven to make pancakes to sell.

loans.name: Marly

texts.es: Gracias por su ayuda y que siempre lo sigan haciendo conmigo y con otras personas  que lo necesitan. Son las palabras de agradecimiento que Marly envía a sus financiadores de Kiva , que le facilitaron la forma de invertir bien y ganar dinero con su anterior credikiva. Hoy nuevamente está aplicando a un financiamiento mediante el cual comprará ranchos, víveres, cárnicos etc, pues son los productos que mayor rotación tienen, sufren muchos aumentos en los precios y con compras en volumen, puede frenar ese incremento y tratar mejor a su clientela en precios para ser mas   competitivo  y ganar mucho mas. Esto es justamente lo que hace a la inversión de credikiva muy exitosa.
texts.en:
"Thank you for your help offered to me and others who need it." These are the words of thanks that Marly sends to her Kiva lenders who have made it possible for her to invest in her business and increase her earnings through her previous Kiva loan. 

Today she is requesting another loan in order to buy boxed lunches, groceries, meats, and other products that sell fastest in her store. Prices have increased for these so Marly plans to buy her merchandise in bulk to get the best prices so she will earn more while passing the savings onto her customers through competitive prices. This is exactly what makes her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy boxed lunches, groceries, meats, etc.

loans.name: Talbiniso

texts.ru: Талбинисо 38 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Ее муж работает наемным рабочим. Талбинисо тоже трудится наравне с мужем. Она занимается животноводством в течение 11 лет и является опытным скотоводом. Талбинисо покупает коров и телят, откармиливает их несколько месяцев и затем продает их с наценкой. Сейчас Талбинисо запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи скота с целью расширения своей животноводческой деятельности.
texts.en:
Talbiniso is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Her husband is a hired worker. Talbiniso also works, just like her husband. She has been engaged in cattle breeding for a period of 11 years and has experience as a herdsman. 

Talbiniso purchases cows and bulls, fattens them a few months and thereafter sells them at a premium. Currently Talbiniso requests a loan for the purchasing cattle for reselling with an aim to broaden her cattle breeding business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Mahdya

texts.en:
Mahdya is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother to three sons and two daughters. Her husband is employed in a local center and the low income he earns is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Mahdya wants to create better living conditions for her family, and so requests a loan of USD 2,000 from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN)  to cover the cost of painting her house and fixing the external wall of her house. This will ensure better living conditions for Mahdya and her family and enable them to enjoy living in their house.

Mahdya is photographed next to her house.

loans.use: to paint her house and fix its external wall.

loans.name: Vaiana

texts.en: Vaiana is a 36-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, caprioca and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Vaiana has requested a loan to buy weed spray, weed killer, bush knives, a mist blower, banana chemicals and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2010. With her profits, Vaiana hopes to improve her business in order to help in her family matters and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase bush knives, weed killer, weed spray, a mist blower and a wheelbarrow for her agricultural business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a store for her business.

loans.name: Siloi

texts.en: Siloi is 23 years old, and single, with two children. She plans to start a business selling crafts, design materials, tapa cloths, weaving fans, weaving mats and design boards. She has requested a loan to buy paints, rubber rollers, brushes, tools and fabric materials. Siloi will use her profits to improve her business to help her her family and to educate her children. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012.

loans.use: to purchase paint, materials, rubber, tools and fabric materials for her business.

loans.name: Nicolasita

texts.en: Nicolasita is widowed and has five children. She is 55 years old, and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Nicolasita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale, to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizer. Recently, Nicolasita joined GDMPC. In the future, Nicolasita wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали 40 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. Он со своей семьей живет в городе Вахдат. У Шерали среднее техническое образование. В течение 5 лет он работал педагогом в средней школе. Последние 7 лет Шерали занимается животноводством. Он покупает коров и телят, откармливает их несколько месяцев и затем продает их с наценкой на скотном рынке. Сейчас Шерали просит кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота, чтобы расширить свою животноводческую деятельность.
texts.en: Sherali is 40 years old, married, and the father of three children.  Hi lives with his family in the city of Vahdat.  He has received a higher education and worked for five years as a teacher at a high school.  For the past seven years he has worked with livestock.  He buys cows and calves, fattens them over a period of a few months, then sells them at market for a premium.  Now Sherali is asking for a loan to buy more cattle to resell in order to expand his livestock business.

loans.use: To buy cattle to resell.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese is a 36-year-old single woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yams, green beans, green pepper and green onions to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Akenese has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, spades, fertilizers, snail chemicals, a rake, gloves, weed killers and weed spray. Akenese joined SPBD in 2013. With her profits, she hopes to help her family members and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, snail chemicals, weed killer, gloves and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Kaftarmo

texts.ru: Кафтармо жительница города Вахдат. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем и мать четверых детей. Кафтармо добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она занимается торговлей более 11 лет. На рынке города Кафтармо имеет магазин, где продает продукты питания, такие как: печенье, булочки и т.д. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот и получить хорошую прибыль, Кафтармо обратилась за кредитом. Она просит кредит для приобретения продуктов питания в свой магазин и расширения своей торговой деятельности.
texts.en: Kaftarmo is a resident of the city Vahdat.  She's 45 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She is a kind and hardworking woman who has been engaged in trade for more than 11 years.  She has a store at a city market where she sells food products such as cookies and rolls.  In order to increase her turnover as well as her income, Kaftarmo is taking out a loan.  This loan will help her purchase more goods for her store and expand her business activities.

loans.use: to buy food products to expand her business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан житель Спитаменского района. Ему 39 лет. У него жена и трое детей. Его жена работает в столовой помощницей повара. Сам Хасан занимается животноводством в течение 6 лет. Он покупает, откармливает и перепродает скот. Одновременно Хасан работает мастером столяром. Сейчас Хасан хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. С этим намерением он берет кредит для купли и продажи скота.
texts.en: Hasan lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan.  He is 39 years old, married and the father of three children.  His wife works as a cook at a restaurant.  Hasan has worked with livestock for 6 years.  He buys, fattens and sells livestock.  He also works as a master carpenter.  Now, he would like to expand his business in order to increase his income.  To achieve this, he is taking out a loan to buy more livestock to resell.

loans.use: to buy livestock to resell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is 30 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling rice and curry, snacks, drinks, donuts, german buns and cream buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy food ingredients and cooking equipment. In the future, Luisa hopes to earn more profit to improve her business to help her family and her kids' education. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot and a gas oven.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 25-year-old single woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows green beans, green pepper, green onions, round cabbages and pok choi to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Daisy has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, snail chemicals, a hose, gloves and a mist blower. 
She joined SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Daisy hopes to improve her business to help her family members.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, snail chemicals, a hose, gloves and a mist blower.

loans.name: Talaloa

texts.en: Talaloa is 61 years old and married with six children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy food ingredients and cooking equipment. In the future, Talaloa hopes to improve her business to help her family. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, a gas oven, baking soda and a large cooking pot.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is married. She is 60 years old, and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Ester owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale, to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer. Recently, Ester joined GDMPC. In the future, Ester wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Segundo Carlos

texts.es:
SEGUNDO CARLOS tiene 47 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

SEGUNDO CARLOS se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cebada. Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza, ranger. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Chimbo.

El sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es luchar ante culquier problema que se le presente.
En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce con la familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Carlos is 47 years old, is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in the city of Chimbo in the province of Bolivar. 

Segundo Carlos makes a living from agriculture; growing corn and barley. He requests a loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea and Ranger, a liquid weed killer. With the loan, he will be able to buy what is necessary for crop growing. Purchases will be done in the city of Chimbo. 

His dream is to improve his quality of life. The challenge he faces is to fight unexpected problems. 

In the free time he likes to gather with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea and Ranger, a liquid weed killer

loans.name: Maky

texts.fr:
Monsieur  MAKY est âgé de 22 ans et célibataire sans enfant. Il  vit dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, il commença à faire les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père qui menait plusieurs activités (courtier, vente d’articles divers,  etc.)  Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à son côté, il   décide d’évoluer seul en menant les activités d’achat et de vente de carburant et lubrifiants. Il   mène cette activité depuis 9 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de bénéfice, il rentre en collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de 12 mois. 
Il compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter 70 litres d’essence. Il  s’approvisionne sur place. 
Monsieur  MAKY vend au comptant  à une clientèle mixte. Avec ce prêt il   envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
Maky is 22 years old. He is single and has no children.  He lives in a traditional family in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of the city of Ségou.  For social reasons, Maky did not attend school.  Instead, he got involved in income-generating activities, working alongside his father who was himself involved in several activities (he worked as a middleman, sold various goods etc.)  After learning from his father for several years, Maky decided to work on his own and started to buy and sell fuel and lubricants.  He has been involved in this business for nine years and is very experienced in his field.  He has many customers.

Eager to expand his business and to make more profits, Maky joined Soro Yiriwaso over a year ago.  He plans to use this new loan to buy 70 liters of gasoline.  He stocks up locally.

Maky sells his goods for cash to both men and women.  With his loan, he is expecting monthly profits to reach 60,000 CFA francs, which will allow him to repay his loan and diversify his activity.

loans.use: to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Melisa works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Melisa is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more spices to sell in her food stall.

Melisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 20 meters of fabric.

loans.name: Sira

texts.fr:
Madame  Sira est âgée  de 34 ans, marié et mère de 3 enfants. Elle   vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec d’autres ménages au quartier Hamdallaye de  Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné très tôt l’école, elle commença à faire le petit commerce auprès de ma mère qui vendait des condiments.  Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage elle évolue seule  pour mener le commerce de cartes téléphoniques, elle mène cette activité depuis 7 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa demande clientèle, elle  rentra en collaboration avec  Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 84 mois, après 14 prêts  solidaires correctement remboursés, elle est à son 1er prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter des cartes téléphoniques, elle s’approvisionne sur place.   
Madame  Sira vend  le plus souvent  au comptant  à une clientèle mixte composée majoritairement de fonctionnaire.  Avec ce prêt il  envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 50 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales et d’augmenter son fonds de commerce.  Son ambition est de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Sira is 34 years old.  She is married and the mother of three children.  She lives in a traditional family setting with other couples and their children.  She is a resident of the Hamdallaye neighborhood of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Sira left school at a very young age, and she got involved in small retail alongside her mother who was selling condiments.  After learning from her mother for several years, she now works alone and sells rechargeable phone cards.  She has been involved in this activity for seven years and has many customers.

Eager to meet her customers' demand, she joined Soro Yiriwaso seven years ago.  Having duly repaid 14 solidarity loans, she is now taking her first individual loan which will be used to buy rechargeable phone cards.  She stocks up locally.

Sira usually sells for cash to both men and women, mostly civil servants.  With this loan, she is expecting monthly profits to reach 50,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to take care of her family's expenses and to increase her business.  She dreams about building a house.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable phone cards.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en:
Kolreti is a 43 year old married woman with three children. She would like to start growing taro, banana and yam to earn a living. Koreti has requested a loan to get all the equipment needed for her business. 
She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Koreti will spend her profits to help with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy shovels, a wheel barrow, gloves, fertilizer, a mist blower, and weed killer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some farming equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming equipment.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, tiene 39 años, es casado y  tiene 2 hijos pequeños , con quienes vive en el terreno de su madre ,lugar en donde construyó su propia casa .El trabajo de Luis consiste en el trasporte de pasajeros de un lugar a otro de forma rápida y segura, ya que cuenta con un mototaxi que le permite realizar este trabajo todos los dias del año . Lleva en ésta actividad más de 7 años, trabaja solo y a diario renueva sus energías para laborar con mucho optimismo y siempre dando lo mejor de sí para que al final del día pueda ver el fruto de su esfuerzo. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, aunque asegura que al principio le fue difícil trabajar como mototaxista porque sentía que le afectaba los riñones por las largas horas que tenía que conducir, ahora maneja sus horarios de trabajo adecuadamente y realiza su trabajo de manera óptima es por eso que sus ingresos se han incrementado y espera continuar de la misma manera. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él para recibir éste crédito y por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará algunos repuestos y accesorios que necesita para refaccionar su mototaxi y pueda continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Luis is 39 years old, married, and has two little children. They live together on his mother's land where they have built their own home. Luis's work consists of transporting passengers from one place to another in a safe and rapid manner. He has a mototaxi which allows him to do this work every day of the year. He has been doing this work for over seven years, he works alone, and each day he renews his energy to work with great enthusiasm. He always doing his best so that at the end of the day he may witness the fruits of his labor. He enjoys his work a lot, although at the beginning it was difficult to work as a mototaxi operator because Luis worried that the long hours he had to drive were hurting his kidneys. Now he is properly managing his hours and doing his job more optimally which has allowed his earnings to increase and allowed him to continue working as usual. For this loan he is requesting 1,000 soles, and he is grateful for the opportunity and the confidence placed with him in granting him this loan. Likewise he promises to comply with the timely payments. With the amount requested Luis will purchase some replacement parts and accessories that he needs to repair his mototaxi in order to continue his work.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts and accessories for a mototaxi.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Apolonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is 55 years old, married, and has 5 children. She lives is Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a vulcanizing shop in the local community to earn a living. She has been running her business for over 6 years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 26,000 PHP to purchase vulcanizing materials. She wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vulcanizing materials

loans.name: Manino

texts.en:
Manino is 32 years old, married and has two children. She has a small plantation where she grows banana, taro and yam that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Manino needs a loan to provide her children an education for this year and to buy new equipment for her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Manino will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees, fertilizer, chemicals, weed killer, and shovels

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is 37 years old, married and has 2 children who are all in school.

Minerva is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Minerva requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Minerva has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Minerva would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 35 years old, married and has three children who are in school.

Analiza is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Analiza requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Analiza has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Perfecto Del Carmen

texts.es:
Perfecto es originario de la comarca La Cuesta, en las afueras de Boaco, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 9 años de los cual el mayor estudia el 7mo grado de secundaria y la niña estudia el 2do grado de primaria en la escuela de la comarca. Perfecto se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y  trigo también sale a comercializar productos plásticos y aluminio como calderos, panas, vasos, mosquiteros,  de forma ambulante en otros pueblos de Boaco. El  inicio su negocio hace 10 años con dinero que le prestaba a otro hermano y actualmente de la ganancia de su negocio ha comprado sus animales y piensa mejorar su casa, para hacer sus trabajos agrícolas paga mozos igual les paga a dos muchachos de la comarca para que le ayuden a vender su mercadería. La cosecha de maíz, frijol y trigo la vende aquí mismo en la comarca  para evitarse muchos gastos de transporte pues no posee vehículo propio para trasladar su cosecha fuera de su comarca.
 Hoy  está solicitando este crédito para comprar peroles, mosquiteros, vasos, cucharas.  

Perfecto dice que con el crédito podrá reforzar más el negocio con más mercadería además que tiene dos personas a quienes les da trabajo y al vender más tendrá más ganancia para poder pagarles mejor por las ventas  también dice que una vez que cancele  sacara otro crédito para vender más productos para uso doméstico y fortalecer sus cultivos de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Perfecto is a native of the district of La Cuesta, on the outskirts of Boaco. He is married and has two children of 13 and 9. The oldest is in 7th grade and his little girl is in 2nd grade in the district’s school. 

Perfecto works growing corn, beans, and wheat; he also sells plastic and aluminum products like kettles, plastic trays, cups, and mosquito net bars as an ambulatory vendor in other villages around Boaco. He began his business 10 years ago with money that his brother lent him. Currently, with the earnings from his business, he has purchased his animals, and he hopes to improve his house. 

In order to carry out his agricultural work, he pays for assistants; he also pays two boys from the area to help him sell his merchandise. He sells the harvest of corn, beans, and wheat right here in the district in order to avoid too many expenses, because he doesn’t have his own vehicle to transport his harvest from the district. 

Today, he is requesting this loan in order to buy pots, mosquito net bars, cups, and spoons. Perfecto says that with this loan, he will be able to further fortify his business with more merchandise. In addition, he has two people to whom he gives work, and when he sells more, he will have more income to pay them more for the sales. He also says that once he settles his debt, he will take out another loan in order to sell more household products and strengthen his crops of basic grains.

loans.use: to purchase pots, mosquito net bars, cups, and spoons.

loans.name: Sabina Cely

texts.en: Sabina Cely is from the small village of Barangcuag, Angadanan. She is 57 years old and is married to Roberto, who is busy managing their farm land. To help her husband, Sabina Cely engages in the retailing business. She has been in this business for 12 years, and usually earns a minimum of 300 PHP a day. Sabina Cely wants to expand and re-stock her general store, but she lacks the necessary capital. For this purpose, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, condiments and assorted breads to sell. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, condiments and assorted breads to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Norma is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2011, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living condition

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Myagmarsuren is 51 years old and lives with her family in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She and her husband reside in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on her son’s yard.  At the same time her son’s family takes shelter in a deteriorated house. Her husband has been working at the department of urban development for five years. Her son has recently begun working as a driver at a private business entity. She herself has been working as a janitor at a high school for eight years and before this job, she worked for twenty-eight years at a public service organization. 

In order to improve her family’s living standard, she wants to build a house on her son’s yard.  Compared to a Mongolian traditional ger, the house will be more spacious and better at heat preservation. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase cement, bricks and planks to build a house. As a result, in harsh winter time, the family can live in a more comfortable and warmer place. The most important aspect of building a house is that it enables the family to burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks and planks for building a house

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further expand her business.

NWTF is re-listing Cecilia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to re-sell.

loans.name: Euginio

texts.en: Euiginio is 59 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a farm in which he grows bananas and sells them in the local community to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2009, and now he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for his farm. He wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a motorcycle driver from Ubay, Bohol. He has been engaged in the motorcycle transport business for more than 7 years now. This is the source of his income.

Reynaldo is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of the vehicle.

In the future, Reynaldo hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn is involved in selling vegetable in the market. She has been in this business for 6 years, and earns a minimum of 2,500 PHP a week. Genelyn is 21 years old and is single. Genelyn wants to have more vegetable to sell. To this end, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP to buy ginger, garlic, tomatoes, potatoes and "calamansi" to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy ginger, garlic, tomatoes, potatoes and "calamansi" to sell

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 28 years old, married and has 2 children, all enrolled in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Criselda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Criselda has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Criselda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Criselda would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Badralmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Badralmaa is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son is a fourth year student at a railroad college and her daughter is first year university student. She herself has been working as a machine operator at a printing company for seven consecutive years. For twenty years, her husband has been working in an electric grid servicing company as an electrician. The automobile the family has been using for transportation has been deteriorating over the years and now it is out of service. She is requesting a loan of 3,100,000 MNT to purchase an electric vehicle.  

Environmental advantages of electric vehicles include, and are not limited to: it releases almost no air pollutants at the place where they are operated. In addition, it is generally easier to build pollution-control systems into centralized power stations than retrofit enormous numbers of cars. Electric vehicles typically create less noise pollution than an internal combustion engine vehicle, whether it is at rest or in motion. Electric vehicles emit no tailpipe CO2 or pollutants such as NOx, NMHC, CO and PM at the point of use. In conclusion, based on above mentioned advantages, purchasing of electric vehicle will contribute to the efforts against air pollution, as well as can be used as an income generator for the family by using it for a taxi service. The borrower is one of the trustworthy clients of our organization and used her previous loan for its very purpose and paid each installment debt on the due dates.

loans.use: to purchase electric vehicle

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetable in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell for vegetable business.

Iluminada has been in this business for one year. Iluminada earns additional income from a general store.

Iluminada has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetable to sell

loans.name: Jeanna

texts.en:
Jeanna is 47 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis, Occidental. She owns and operates a firewood vending business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over five years and earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional firewood to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. Fe is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., in order to purchase manicure and pedicure tools.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase manicure and pedicure tools.

loans.name: Amancia

texts.en:
Amancia is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Amancia has been in this business for 20 years. Amancia earns more income from vegetable vending.

Amancia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gwena

texts.en:
Gwena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, candies, sugar, milk, etc., for her general store business.

Gwena has been in this business for 20 years. Gwena earns more income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and pig fattening businesses.

Gwena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, candies, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 35 years old, and is married with three children. Joseph is engaged in motorcycle repair. He has been in this service for almost five years. Right now, Joseph is requesting a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy oil and raw materials for his repair business. He hopes that he can obtain his desired loan to further develop his business.

loans.use: to buy oil and raw materials for his repair business.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
Digna es una mujer de 31 años de edad trabajadora, humilde, casada que de su matrimonio tiene 5 hijos los cuales son menores de edad 3 de ellos están en la escuela el mayor estudia en un centro básico de la comunidad donde ella habita y la menor de todas aun no va al kinder. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completa por lo cual pudo cursar hasta el sexto grado pero no pudo continuar por la falta de recursos económicos por parte de sus padres ya que lo que ellos podían recibir de su trabajo por la agricultura era poco. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron la actividad de la siembra y cultivo de café, maíz y frijoles a muy temprana edad. Gracias al arduo trabajo que en familia emprendió pudo con el tiempo junto a su esposos pudieron ahorrar para preparar un terreno que fue heredado por sus suegros ubicado a una distancia de 50 metros de su casa de habitación en el cual se trasladan a pie y tienen pensado cultivar café producto que en la región donde ella habita es abundante y fácil de cultivar por la riqueza de la tierra en minerales y otros que hacen que este producto sea seguro.        

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para poder comprar semilla de café y plantas certificadas para poder cultivar en su propiedad y poder generar ingresos para su familia mismos que ayudaran a cubrir los gastos de la canasta básica y otros como la vestimenta, medicinas ,etc. 

Su meta es poder cultivar el producto de café en la propiedad que tiene para poder generar dinero y utilizar las ganancias para poder seguir invirtiendo y poder pagar su compromiso con la institución para poder seguir gozando de los productos que ofrece. Su sueño es poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que ellos puedan graduarse y cumplir cada una de sus metas como también aprender el oficio y algún día poder heredar su sacrificio para que ellos lo administren.
texts.en:
Digna is a humble and hardworking 31-year-old woman. She is married, and she has five minor children from that marriage. Three of them are in primary school, the oldest studies in a secondary school in the community where she lives, and the youngest of all has not yet started kindergarten. 

Digna completed primary school through sixth grade. She wasn't able to continue because of her parents' lack of economic resources, as they were not able to earn much from their agricultural work.  It was her parents who, from an early age, taught her the business of planting and cultivating coffee, corn, and beans.  

Thanks to the hard work that the family has put in, over time Digna and her husband have been able to save to prepare a plot of land that was inherited by her in-laws. It's located 50 meters from her house so they can walk there. They are planning to grow coffee, a product that is abundant in the region where she lives. It's easy to grow because the soil is rich in minerals and other nutrients that make this a reliable crop. 

Currently, Digna is requesting help to be able to buy coffee seeds and certified plants to cultivate on her property in order to generate income for her family; this income will help to cover the cost of basic household goods and other expenses like clothing, medicines, etc.

Her goal is to be able to grow coffee on the property she has in order to make money, using the proceeds to keep investing and to pay back the loan with the institution so that she can continue enjoying the products it offers. Her dream is to be able to continue supporting her children in their educations so that they can graduate and achieve every one of their goals, as well as to learn the trade and someday be able to inherit and manage all she has sacrificed for.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds and certified plants to cultivate on her property.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом замужняя женщина с двумя детьми. Ей 51 год. Ее муж работает формировщиком железобитонных плит, а сын уехал в заграницу на заработки. У Гуландом среднее техническое образование. Она работает медсестрой в поликлинике своего района. Одновременно Гуландом занимается животноводством. Она занимается куплей и продажей крупно-рогатого скота уже более 9 лет и в этом бизнесе ей помогает семья. Сейчас Гуландом намерена расширить свой бизнес. С этой целью она запрашивает кредит для закупа скота с дальнейшим их откормом и продажей.
texts.en: Gulandom is the married mother of two children.  She's 51.  Her husband works as a foreman, overseeing the construction of reinforced concrete slabs, and her son is working in another country to earn money.  Gulandom has received a higher education and works as a nurse in a clinic in her region.  At the same time, she also works with livestock.  She has purchased and resold livestock for more than 9 years.  Her family helps her with this business.  Now, Gulandom is set on expanding her business.  With this goal in mind, she's taking out a loan to buy livestock in order to fatten and resell.

loans.use: To buy cattle to resell.

loans.name: Pei

texts.en:
Pei is 48 years old and married with seven children. She has a small garden where she grows cucumbers, tomatoes, beans and pumpkins that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Pei needs a loan to buy a file, knives, chemicals, weed spray, an axe and a spade for her garden. Pei will use the profits from her sales to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy a file, knives, chemicals, weed spray, an axe and a spade for her garden.

loans.name: Olailagi

texts.en:
Olailagi is 78 years old and married with nine children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community and at the market. She has been doing this for many years.
Olailagi needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, a plant sprayer, fertilizer and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Olailagi will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, bushknives, a plant sprayer and shovels

loans.name: Vaaiga

texts.en: Vaaiga is a 30-year-old single woman with 2 children. She makes and sells barbecue in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Vaaiga needs a loan to buy lamb, chicken, and sausages to improve the quality of her business. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and provide financial support for her family. Easter has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy sausages, chicken legs, lamb and

loans.name: Fuigaveve

texts.en: Fuigaveve is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. She makes and sells woven baskets, woven fans, design boards, and woven table mats to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Fuigaveve has requested a loan to buy pandanus leaves, paints, fabrics and a new sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to help her business and her family. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy pandanus leaves, paints, fabric, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Selvina

texts.en: Selvina, 44 years old, comes from Casibarag province of Isabela. She is married and has five children. Selvina is a diligent person. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy spare parts of the motorcycle to provide better service. She will use this motorcycle to earn additional income by transporting people from one place to another. She hopes that her business will expand so that she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts of the motorcycle to provide better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new materials, a new sewing machine and empty bottles..

loans.name: Faleata

texts.en: Faleata is a 67-year-old married woman with nine children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. Faleata has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, shovels and bushknives. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Faleata hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, shovels, and bush knives

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 62 years old and married with nine children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, bananas and yam that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Nora needs a loan to buy chemicals, a knapsack, spray, knives, an axe and a file for her plantation. She will use the profits from her sales to extend her house.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a knapsack, spray, knives, an axe and a file for her plantation

loans.name: Tujikaze Group

texts.fr: La cliente Myatsi est conseillère du groupe Tujikaze, entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 58 ans,  mariée et mère de 9 enfants, qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un chauffeur. La cliente est une infirmière et sociétaire de l’officine pharmaceutique. Il commença avec un crédit de la tontine (likelemba). Il ya plus de 12 ans, elle fait cette affaire. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les médicaments essentiels  (anti inflammatoires, anti biotiques, sirop, antipaludéens, l’anti diarrhéiques, etc.). Les dettes impayées constituent un défi pour elle. Elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien financier.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bebes.
texts.en:
Myatsi is advisor to the Tujikaze group. She is a dynamic entrepreneur; 58 years old, married and the mother of nine children who are all in school. Her husband is a driver. The group member is a nurse and an associate at the pharmacy.

She started with a credit loan through the local lekelemba (a variety of tontine, or local solidarity group). This was accomplished over 12 years ago. 

This new loan will enable her to buy essential drugs (anti-inflammatory, antibiotics, syrups, anti-malarial, anti-diarrheal, etc.). Dealing with unpaid debts is a challenge for her. She wants schooling for her children.

In the end, she wishes to thank Hekima for its financial support.  It should be noted that some group members carry their babies.

loans.use: purchase essential drugs (anti-inflammatory, antibiotics, syrups, anti-malarial, anti-diarrheal, etc..)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle repair business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her motorcycle repair business.

Grace successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further expand her business.

NWTF is re-listing Grace's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment.

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Alicia del Carmen vive en la cuidad de Managua. Se caracteriza por ser una persona  responsable, amistosa ya que tiene buenas relaciones con sus vecinos.

Doña Alicia está solicitando un crédito a kiva  y ceprodel ya que tiene un pequeño  negocio en su casa y quiere  invertir en la compra  de gaseosa, jugo, repostería, galleta.
 para aumentar su inventario  y sus ganancias ya que con las ganancia que obtiene ayuda a  en los gastos de la familia.

La señora Alicia está muy agradecida con ceprodel porque gracias a los crédito que se le han otorgado las ganancias que le han generado la a invertido en mejoras para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alicia del Carmen lives in the city of Managua.  She is responsible and friendly and has a good relationship with her neighbours.

Alicia is applying for a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel as she has a small business in her home and she would like to buy fizzy drinks, juice, cakes and biscuits to increase her stock and income.  A higher income helps with household costs.

Alicia is very grateful to Ceprodel because the loans granted to her have generated an income which she has invested in making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, cakes, bread, juice and pizza.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. Marilou is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Marilou requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and utensils for her business.

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and utensils for her business

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Reanato is 45 years old and single. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

He owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting mango for sale to earn a living. He has been in his business for over seven years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. 

He joined GDMPC in 2010 and now he has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Altansumber

texts.en:
Mr. Altansumber is 26 years old and lives with his mother and a sibling in Ger in Uvs province, Mongolia. His mother is retired and stays at home running a small tailoring service business and the sibling goes to a local specialty training school. 

The borrower has been working at a local company as a driver for years and he used to provide an intercity transportation service with a small truck. He is now requesting 750,000MNT to purchase an Eco-friendly, energy efficient vehicle to run his taxi service business in town. 

He is a hardworking, energetic and well-behaved man.

loans.use: to purchase an Eco-friendly, energy efficient vehicle to run his taxi service business in town

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a 50-year-old married man and a father of four grown-up children from Ubay, Bohol. 

He earns a living through his rice farming business. 

Ricardo needs a loan for his farm. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farm and its harvest.

In the future, Ricardo hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Carlos Horacio

texts.es: Don Carlos un humilde mecánico, agradece la oportunidad que  le brindo el crédito kiva ya que se siente muy satisfecho con su primer crédito por le ha ayudado a invertir mas en su taller comprando todas las herramientas que aun no tenia en inventario,  como taladros, lijas, el cual esta muy orgulloso porque ha podido ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Carlos esta requiriendo de su segundo crédito para comprar herramientas como lijas, taladro y casco de motocicletas, con el objetivo de ir creciendo en su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio especializado a su clientela.
texts.en: Carlos is a poor mechanic and he is grateful for the opportunities that arose from receiving a Kiva loan.  He was very satisfied with his first loan as it helped him to invest more in his workshop by buying all the tools that he did not have on his inventory, such as drills and sandpaper.  He is now very proud because he has been able to offer better service to his customers.  Carlos needs a second loan to buy tools such as sandpaper, a drill and a motorcycle helmet, so that he can continue to expand the business and provide a more specialised service to customers.

loans.use: to buy tools such as sandpaper, a drill and a motorcycle helmet.

loans.name: Jodelyn

texts.en:
Jodelyn works hard to support one child. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jodelyn requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Jodelyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 63 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Luz has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish and other seafoods to sell.

Luz has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fish and other seafoods to sell.

loans.name: Rose Belinda

texts.en:
Rose Belinda is 44 years old and is married. 

She has been engaged in her food stall business for one year. At first, she struggled to promote her restaurant because she was new in the business. But as time passed, she learned more about the business and how to attract customers. 

She earns PHP 3,000 every day and usually uses it for the education of her children. To increase sales, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 (Philippine peso) to buy meat and vegetables to cook and to buy dishes, glasses and pottery to use in her restaurant. 

She hopes it will contribute to a better income in order to save for emergencies and educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy meat and vegetables to cook and to buy dishes, glasses and pottery to use in her restaurant

loans.name: Duvan De Jesus

texts.es:
Duvan, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para el cultivo de maíz y para el cuido del ganado, estas dos actividades él quiere continuar trabajándolas, para comenzar con la siembra agrícola de la temporada necesita comprar abono el cual lo aplicara, en la ganadería pagara el alquiler de una maquina moledora de zacate, con esto alimenta el ganado.
Con el préstamo anterior, el manifiesta que aumento su cosecha que los utilizo para generar más ingresos a la familia, pagando algunos gastos en estudio de sus hijos, con la inversión del crédito Kiva ha mejorado sus condiciones  y mantiene estable al grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Duvan has decided to apply for another loan for growing corn and for looking after his cattle.  He wants to continue working in these two areas. So as to begin the planting season he needs to buy fertiliser and, for the cattle, he will rent a machine for grinding the fodder that he feeds them.

With his previous loan, Duvan demonstrated that he increased his harvest which he used to generate more income for the family.  As a result he paid costs such as his children's education.  With the investment from Kiva, Duvan has improved his living conditions and he keeps the family stable.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and to pay for machinery to grind fodder.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn works hard to support one child. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Rodelyn requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Rodelyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 57 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Leonila has a food vending business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Leonila has been in this business for four years. In the future, Leonila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Mr. Altangerel is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on his fenced land.  

He has been working as a concrete mason at a building company for four consecutive years. His wife also works at the same company as a member of the construction armature crew. His eldest child is five years old and youngest child is three years old. 

He is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to purchase building materials, such as planks, cement, bricks and metals to build a house on his land. In doing so, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place, where they will burn less coal; thus contributing to efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. 

Also, at this time of year, the price of building materials generally reaches its lowest rate and purchasing building materials now will save large amounts of money for him. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials, such as cement, planks and bricks

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Edna is borrowing PHP 4,600 through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Edna is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 32 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting coconuts to earn a living. She has been in her business for over four years and earns 3,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010 and now she has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for the farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Sharimar

texts.en:
Sharimar is 23 years old and still single. She started selling street food to help her parents to raise their family. She has been in this business for one year, and usually earns a net income of around PHP 500 a day. 

Right now, Sharimar is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy flour, vegetable oil, chicken and hot dogs to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, vegetable oil, chicken and hot dogs to sell

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 35 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marisa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Marisa has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Marisa would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy two sacks of condiments

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr: La cliente Simisi est président et doyenne du groupe Faida. Âgée de 70 ans, Mariée, mère et grand mère de plusieurs petits fils. Son conjoint est sans emploie. La cliente est vendeuse des souliers dans un marché de la place. Elle commença son activité avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il y a 5 ans révolus, elle exerce cette activité. Les défis pour cette cliente, sont les impayés et les pertes divers. Le nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 30 paires de souliers. Dans le futur, elle souhaite construire une maison et accroître son capital. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien financier.
texts.en:
Simisi is the leader and oldest member of the Faida group. She is 70 years old, married, a mother, and a grandmother to several grandchildren. Her husband is without work. 

She sells shoes in a local market. She started this business with funds received from her husband and has been doing this for the last five years. 

Simisi is facing unpaid accounts and other losses. This new loan is going to permit her to buy thirty pairs of shoes. 

In the future, she would like to build a house and save up her money. 

Simisi thanks Hekima for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy thirty paris of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile est une femme de 39 ans, marié et mère de 03 enfants. elle possède et gère un mini bar depuis 2 ans où elle y vend des boissons hygiéniques. elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises (casier de boisson et bouteilles) et faire des petits aménagements (achat tables et réhabilitation du local)afin d'accroître sa rentabilité et ses profits. les bénéfices générés seront injecté dans l'activité afin de l'agrandir d'une part et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille (nutrition, éducation)
texts.en:
Cécile, age 39, is married and the mother of three children. For two years, she's been running her own small bar where she sells soft drinks. 

She's seeking this loan to bolster her stock by buying cases of drinks and bottles, and to improve her bar by buying tables and refitting the place.

Her goal is to improve the profitability of her business and increase her profits. She will reinvest one part of the profits in her business in order to expand it. The remainder will be used to provide food and education to her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks and refit her bar

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia de 44 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 3 años. Aprovechando la experiencia de su esposo de hace 20 años, Patricia  tomó un local de su familia e inició con él, su propia aventura de negocio, que consiste en la venta de carne y productos desechables,. Para ello   destinó ese espacio como punto de distribución y ventas. Su negocio poco a poco  fue creciendo y mientras ella trabajaba como empleada y al mismo tiempo apoyaba a su esposo, se dificultó  la atención de su pequeña hija, esta fue la razón para que desistiera de su trabajo y se dedicara exclusivamente a su propio negocio. La experiencia de su esposo y la familia de él,  fue el impacto más importante y positivo para fortalecerlo. Hoy sus expectativas de crecimiento son superiores a las de ese momento, pues se encuentran bien ubicados en la plaza, en una vía de gran circulación vehicular lo que potencializa el incremento de sus ventas. Su mayor competencia son las tiendas que venden en poca cantidad los productos que ella ofrece, y a un precio superior;  su especialidad en el mercado hace que sea cada día   mas concurrido su establecimiento, y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará carne de res, de ave, porcina y pescado en mayor volumen,  para responderle a su clientela que diariamente se incrementa. Así mismo comprará platos, vasos y otros productos desechables con los cuales logrará descuentos especiales y ofrecerá una vez mas buenos precios a su clientela mientras ella gana dinero por sus ventas en volúmenes y  esta es justamente la razón de éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Patricia, 44, lives in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and three-year-old son.  Taking advantage of her husband's 20 years of experience, Patricia opened a butcher shop in a family-owned locale through a joint venture with her husband.  They sell meat and disposable products.  The business grew little by little and even though she worked elsewhere, she helped her husband out part-time.  But it got difficult to care for her child so she decided to quit work and dedicate her time exclusively to the business.

The experience from her husband and his family was the most important, positive factor in strengthening the business.  Today, their growth expectations are higher than they were before because they are in a good location with a lot of vehicle traffic that will help increase sales.  Their competitors are stores that sell less quantity of the same products at a higher price, so that means their shop has more customers.  This is exactly why she is requesting a CrediKiva loan, her first from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  It will be used to buy beef, poultry, pork and fish in larger quantities in order to supply the increased daily demand.  She also will buy disposable plates, cups and other products at discount prices.  She will offer better prices to the customers and earn a higher income from the sales volume.  This is the reason for the investment.

loans.use: To buy beef, poultry, pork and fish, and disposable plates and cups.

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es:
Eduardo, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, ya que estará iniciando el cultivo de granos básicos, para esto necesita comprar abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra, estos son los principales materiales por los que se encuentra solicitando préstamo.
Con el préstamo anterior él  considera que la producción aumento y sus ingresos le  han servido para invertir en los gastos del hogar, toda su familia goza de buena salud y están estables.
texts.en:
Eduardo has decided to request a new loan because he will begin planting basic grains and needs to buy the main supplies, such as fertilizers and herbicides.  He will also hire workers.

He used the previous loan to increase production, and was able to use the income to cover household expenses.  His family is in good health and has a stable income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn is married with two children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Remalyn is 28 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Remalyn has a corn vending business in the Philippines.  Remalyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of corn to sell.  Remalyn has been in this business for 5 years.  In the future, Remalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of corn to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 42 year old married man and a father of five children from Alicia, Bohol.  He has been running a sari-sari or variety store business in his place for more than 15 years now.

Robert is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, rice, candies, biscuits and snack foods, noodles, soda , soap and toiletries.  Robert believes that this loan could help him in improving his business and its income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, rice, candies, biscuits and snack foods, noodles, soda , soap and toiletries

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia, 52 years of age, married and blessed with four children.  She owns and operates a junk shop which she sells recycled materials such as plastic bottles, old newspapers, and old spare parts of motorcycle/cars.  In this business she's earning a net income amounting to PHP 4,500 a month. 

She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase used plastic bottles, and scrap materials to sell.  She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she is able to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase used plastic bottles, and scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Carlos Saul

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos  tiene 19 años y es soltero con 1 hijo que  tiene la edad de un añito,   el se dedica a la compra, arreglo  y venta de motos tiene su taller  que se encuentran en la localidad de  Santa Rita,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Carlos  va a usar este préstamo para el compra de una moto que le ofrecieron a buen precio para después arreglarla y venderla  un precio más alto  y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es ampliar su negocio para generar más utilidades El Sr. Carlos  tiene el deseo de mejorar su calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando herramientas para el arreglo de sus motos.
texts.en: Carlos, 19, is single and has a one-year-old son.  He buys, repairs and sells motorcycles at his workshop in the town of Santa Rita.  This is his second loan from the institution.  Carlos plans to use the loan to buy a motorcycle he is being offered at a good price.  He will repair it and sell it to increase his work capital.  The loan will help to increase business and generate more profit.  Carlos wants to improve his quality of life and use the profits to continue buying tools for his repair business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is 35 years old, married with 2 children.  She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  She owns and operates a farm which grows vegetables for sale in the local community to earn a living.  She has been in this business for over 5 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 60-years-old and married with three children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Paz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more groceries to sell.  She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soap, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future Paz would like to save money to expand her business and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en: Flor is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She has a retail store based in her home where she earns about 1,500 PHP a week. Right now, Flor is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase groceries item such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee, and other ingredients. Her family is her motivational guide in improving her business. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income and allows her to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase groceries item such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: Daysi, de 29 años, esta casada con Arbildo ,quien se dedica a la construcción de viviendas y con quien tiene  03 hijos, de 13, 10 y 02 años respectivamente, todos viven cómodamente en su casa propia la cual fue comprada con el fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación.El trabajo de Daysi, consiste en la venta de frutas regionales durante el día y la venta de comidas regionales durante la noche ,entre los distintos platos que ofrece a sus comensales tenemos la patarahsca, pollo a la parrilla, chorizo ahumado, tacacho, Juanes, a su vez estos van a compañados de sus bebidas refrescantes. Lleva 05 años realizando este trabajo, al cual se dedica sola .Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener ingresos en su hogar, además la cocina siempre fue su pasión y es algo que le gusta desde muy pequeña, felizmente todo le esta yendo bien ya que sus clientes son fieles por su buena sazón y muy buen trato.Este será el préstamo numero 01 con Kiva, razón por la cual está muy agradecida con la institución ya que le permitira tener una mejor económia .Con el monto solicitado de 600 soles, comprará bebidas refrescantes para ofrecer a los clientes que acuden en busca de sus platos tipicos y tambien comprará frutas regionales tales como aguajes, naranjas, anonas entre otros.
texts.en:
Daysi, 29, is married to Arbildo, a residential construction worker, and they have three children, ages 13, 10 and 2.  They all live comfortably in their own home that was bought through much effort and dedication.  Daysi's work consists of selling regional fruits during the day and regional foods at night.  Among the different dishes she serves the customers are patarashca (fish), broiled chicken, smoked sausage, tacacho (pork in banana leaves), and Juanes (chicken in banana leaves).  She also sells soft drinks.  She has been in business for five years and works alone.

What she likes about her work is that she has her own income for the household.  Cooking has always been her passion and she has done it since she was a little girl.  Luckily, everying is going well and she has a lot of customers because of her delicious cooking and customer service.  This will be her first Kiva loan, so she is very grateful to the institution for allowing her to have a better economy.  She will use the 600 PEN loan to buy soft drinks who come for her cooking.  She will also buy regional fruit such as aguajes, oranges, anonas, etc.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and fruit.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 57-year-old widow with six children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Diana is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional seeds, fertilizers and other farming equipment. Diana has been farming vegetables for 4 years and also earns additional income from fishing.
