She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, fertilizers and other farming equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a married woman and the mother of seven grownup children from Ubay, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Rufina is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her stock and she can cater more buyers in her store.

In the future, Rufina hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. Rosa is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Rosa requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase ready-to-wear such as pants, t-shirts, bags, etc. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Rosa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear such as pants, t-shirts, bags, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
Carlos, se ha decidido por mejorar en su cultivo de maíz, para esto debe aplicar los insumos como semilla, abono, herbicidas, que son los materiales que le dan al cultivo el fortalecimiento necesario para prevenir las plagas y que se desarrollen.
Él manifiesta que con la utilización del crédito anterior mejoro su producción, sus ingresos por las ventas y en su familia un notable cambio.
texts.en:
Carlos wants to improve his corn plantation, so he must get hold of different supplies such as seeds, compost and herbicides, which are needed in order to give it enough strength to prevent plagues and flourish.

Carlos says that the previous loan helped him improve his production and his income and had a noticeable impact on his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is engaged in a transportation business using their motorcycle. She has been in this business for five years and earns 300 PHP a day. Maricar is 27 years old now and is married with one child.

Right now Maricar is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to buy oil, a new sprocket and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes that she can obtain her desire for her loan, which is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy oil, a new sprocket and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander  de  31 años de edad, es cliente Kiva, el está muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado de su primer crédito, ya que le vino cuando mas lo necesitaba para poder invertir mas en su negocio comprando toda la materia prima como, harina, carne, aceite y verduras  que necesitaba para la elaboración de sus deliciosas enchilaladas (tortillas rellenas de carne y arroz). Alexander ahora está solicitando el segundo financiamiento para comprar leña, harina, repollo, arroz, aceite, carne, etc. para elaborar más cantidad de enchiladas de esta manera mejorar sus ventas.  Siempre mantiene la idea de poder tener un bufet de comidas caseras ofreciendo platos típicos.
texts.en: Alexander is 31 years old and a Kiva client. He is very grateful for the support of his first loan since it came when he most needed it. He was able to invest more in his business to purchase raw materials like flour, meat, oil and vegetables needed to make his delicious enchiladas (tortillas filled with meat and rice). Alexander is now requesting a second loan in order to buy firewood, flour, cabbage, rice, oil, meat, etc. to make a great quantity of enchiladas, so he can improve his sales.  He always has the idea of having a buffet offering homemade dishes.

loans.use: buy firewood, flour, cabbage, rice, oil and meat.

loans.name: Marybel

texts.es: Marybel con su previo credikiva compró pescado aguacates y vendió mucho mas, sus ingresos se incrementaron debido a que tuvo más capital de trabajo para invertir  y atender las solicitudes de su clientela. Desde que recibió su credikiva agregó otros productos cárnicos como vísceras, lo cual gustó a muchos de sus compradores que tienen negocios. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará productos del mar y aguacates en mayor volumen. Marybel dice a sus financiadores de Kiva, que gracias por esta oportunidad porque ella no tenia experiencia crediticia y ahora tiene mas opciones de acceso a créditos.
texts.en: Marybel used her previous Kiva loan to buy fish and avocados.  As a result, her sales went up and her income increased, which meant that she then had more working capital to invest and to use to cater for her customers’ needs.  Since she received her Kiva loan, she has started to stock other meat products such as offal, which has proved popular with many of her customers who have businesses.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy seafood and avocados in greater quantities.  Marybel would like to thank her Kiva sponsors for this opportunity because she had no previous credit record and now she has more options for accessing loans.

loans.use: to buy seafood and avocados in greater quantities

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 53 años, es una señora trabajadora y optimista, esta casada con Rómulo con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 30, 21, 15 y 11 años de edad, tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de sus hijos y su esposo con quien trabaja a diario para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.EL trabajo de Yolanda consiste en la venta de pescado, sale temprano al puerto principal de la ciudad en busca de los pescados mas grandes y frescos, de ahí sale a la carretera, y es en este lugar en donde coloca su puesto de ventas ya que cuenta con clientes que siempre la esperan para poder comprarle sus pescado los cuales son ofrecidos a un buen precio, lleva realizando este trabajo por un promedio de 10 años y lo que no le gusta es que tiene que dejar solos a sus hijos, pero es un sacrificio que debe hacer para darles lo mejor y tener ingresos en su hogar, espera poder consolidarse aun mas con su venta y poner un almacén de venta de pescado fresco y seco.Este será el primer préstamo con Kiva y  esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brinda la institución para poder aumentar su capital y su vez se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará pescado en mayor cantidad, además hielo y algunos materiales mas que necesita para poder seguir haciendo su trabajo.
texts.en: Yolanda is 53 years old. She is a hardworking and optimistic woman. She is married to Rómulo, with whom she has four children, aged 30, 21, 15 and 11. She owns her own home where she lives with her children and husband, with whom she works every day to offer her family a better quality of life. Yolanda's work is selling fish. She goes early to the main port in the city seeking the largest and freshest fish. From there she goes to the highway, because that is where she sets up her booth, since she has customers who wait for her to buy her fish, that she offers at a good price. She has been doing this work for about 10 years and what she doesn't like is that she has to leave her children, a sacrifice she has to make because she has to give them the best and have income for the home. She hopes to be able to consolidate more with her sales and open a store selling fresh and dried fish. This will be her first Kiva loan. She is very grateful for the opportunity that has been offered by the institution to increase her capital. She is committed to making her payments on time. With the amount she has asked for, 1500 soles, she will buy a larger quantity of fish as well as ice and some other materials that she needs to be able to keep doing her job.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Añoranza Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento AÑORANZA está compuesto por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Julia tiene 28 años, tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 10 y 8 años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, ella es   Panadera desde hace 8 años, su panadería se encuentra en la localidad de Zanja Honda este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución el anterior crédito lo utilizo para su negocio, la Sra. Julia utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, levadura y manteca para la elaboración de pan su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de insumos por mayor ya que es más barato comprar por cantidad, la Sra. Julia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener más clientela y así de esta manera generar más ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en brindar  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, la Sra. Julia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a todas sus compañeras de grupo ya que son personas que trabajan duro para sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en: The AÑORANZA communal bank is made up of nine members, eight women and one man. The president of the bank is Julia. She is 28 years old. She has two children, aged 10 and 8. She makes and sells bread and has been a bread baker for more than 8 years. Her bakery is located in the community of Zanja Honda. This loan is her second cycle in the institution. She used the previous loan for her business. Julia will use this loan to buy ingredients such as flour, yeast and lard to make the bread. Her reason for asking for this loan is to buy the ingredients wholesale, since it is cheaper to buy in large quantities. Julia faces challenges in her business, such as getting more customers and in this way generating more income. She is going to use the profits to offer a better quality of life for her family. Julia feels happy and grateful with the institution for the support it has offered to her and to all of the other members of the group, because they are people who work very hard to get their families ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, yeast and lard.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tubes, beams and laminate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a laborer to cultivate her land and purchase corn seeds.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 43 years old, married and has four children. She has managed her retail store for over 10 years now and earns about 20,000 PHP monthly. Clara is very approachable and friendly in attending to the needs of the customers who come to buy merchandise in her store. She wants to gain more profits but has insufficient fund. Because of this, she is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy sardines, eggs, biscuits, noodles, soap and breads to sell.

Clara hopes to keep achieving profitable sales to pay school fees and someday achieve a better way of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, biscuits, noodles, soap and breads to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 46 years old and married to a technician. They had three children. All are attending to school. To supplement her spouse's income, she sells grocery items in her store. Aside from the store, she also sells AVON products (cosmetics and perfumes). Angela manages her family's monthly income of about 20,000 PHP to pay for her family's meals, bills at home and education expenses. 

She is now asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, eggs, breads, noodles to sell. She hopes to keep extending good products and services to her customers and keep improving sales from her business. 

Being a diligent entrepreneur, Angela will achieve good sales and fund to educate her children. Someday, it will lead them to a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, eggs, breads, noodles to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 43 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Rosalie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy meat, chicken and ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken and ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell to customers.

She has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell to customers.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 50 years old and is married with one child. To make a living, she is engaged in selling blankets and curtains around their village. She has been in this business for almost one year. Right now, Analyn needs additional capital. In this regard, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy more blankets and curtains to sell. She hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Leonidas Enrique

texts.es:
LEONIDAS ENRIQUE tiene 22 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

LEONIDAS ENRIQUE se dedica a realizar servicios profesionales. Solicita el crédito para comprar una portatil, impresora. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para seguir adelantando el trabajo en casa. Los desafíos a los que se presenta es mejorar el estudio superior. El sueño es terminar la ingeniería. En el tiempo libre le gusta viajar por el mundo.
texts.en:
Leonidas Enrique is 22 years old. He is single and does not have children. He lives with his parents in the city of Chimbo in the Bolivar Province.

Leonidas Enrique provides professional services. He is requesting this loan to buy a laptop and a printer. With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he is missing to continue advancing his work at home. The challenge he faces is the improvement of his higher education studies. His dream is to finish studying engineering. In his free time he likes to travel the world.

loans.use: to buy a laptop and a printer.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: José de 47 años de edad, un humilde agricultor quien se dedica a la siembra  y cosecha de café, agradece por la oportunidad brindada de su primer préstamo, ya que el se siente muy agradecido  porque  pudo darle mejor mantenimiento a su siembra  comprando insumo, fertilizantes y pagando mano de obra para la siembra de café. El esta solicitando su segundo financiamiento para seguir invirtiendo en lo mismo de compra de insumos, fertilizantes, pago mano de obra, ya que su deseo es ampliar el área de su siembras de café orgánico, para que le genere mejores rendimientos  en su cosecha  y parovechar al mximo la tiere fertil que es muy optima para este tipo de cultivos.
texts.en:
José, 47 years old, is a humble farmer who sows and harvests coffee. He is grateful for the opportunity provided by his first loan. He feels very grateful because he was able to maintain his crop by buying supplies and fertilizers, and paying his workforce to plant coffee.

He is applying for his second loan to continue investing in the same purchase of supplies and fertilizers, and to cover labor costs. His wish is to increase the area of his organic coffee crop so that it generates better yields for him in the harvest y to take maximum advantage of the fertile ground that is optimal for this type of farming.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora is 63 years old and widowed with 3 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a food business to earn a living. She has such items as shrimps and crabs for sale in the local community. She has been with her business for over 10 years and earns about 19,000PHP every month doing this kind of business. She joined GDMPC in 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 22,000PHP to purchase additional shrimp and crabs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional shrimps and crabs.

loans.name: Yane

texts.en:
Yane is a 35-year-old woman and is married to Dominggus, a 36-year-old man. They have two children -- Yosua, age 11, and Sonya, age 9. Both children go to school.

Yane has a furniture-selling business. She has been running the business for more than 10 years with her husband. From this business,Yane is able to generate an income to meet her family's needs and the educational needs of her children.  

She would like to improve her business by purchasing more equipment. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from TLM in the amount of IDR 12,500,000. She will use the loan to purchase materials and tools to make furniture with such as wood, a ripsaw and an electric saw. 

Yane really hopes that TLM will give her a chance to improve her business through the loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials and tools to make furniture with such as wood, a ripsaw and an electric saw.

loans.name: Jemimah's Group

texts.en:
Jemimah is 33 years old and has three children. She sells second-hand clothes and works in a retail shop to earn money for her family. Jemimah faces the challenge of not having enough money to buy large quantities of products to sell, resulting in the loss of wholesale discounts. 

Jemimah is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that she may use the profits from her tree farm to educate her children and build her family a home with electricity and running water. She appreciates that KOMAZA is giving farmers trees in the form of a loan and they will make money after the tree harvest.

loans.use: to purchase eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She has earned a living through her fishing business, together with her husband, for more than 15 years now. 

Teresita is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and an engine for her boat. In the future, she hopes to make their fishing business a success so that it will continue to generate the income necessary to meet the needs of her family, especially for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and an engine for her boat

loans.name: Kangombe's Group

texts.en:
Kang'ombe is a 38-year-old mother of seven children and a dry-land farmer. She grows maize, but also resorts to charcoal making to earn money for her family. 

Kang'ombe is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because she knows that her tree farm will earn her money so that she can educate her children. When asked where she sees herself in ten years' time, Kang'ombe determinedly states that her "children will have an education."

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Zawadi's Group

texts.en: Zawadi, a name that means "present" in Swahili, is a thirty-two-year-old dryland farmer and mother of six children. She grows maize and raises goats; her husband is a farmer too. Due to drought, her agricultural business faces low yields and subsequently her family faces food shortages. Zawadi is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that she will "have money to buy food and will educate the children."

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 55 years old, a married man, and has four children. Alexander is an entrepreneur who raises hogs and sells them to butchers when they reach the desired weight. He usually earns about P3,000 for each hog disposed of. He uses the money for school fees. He is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs' sustainability.

Alexander is aiming to keep raising healthy hogs to offer them at a higher price and have an income increase, too. Someday he hopes to become a successful hog raiser in their village.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hogs' sustainability

loans.name: Bendera's Group

texts.en: Bendera is a fifty-five-year-old mother of eight children and wife of a dryland farmer. She collects and sells firewood to earn money to support her family. Bendera is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that she may buy land for her family and buy a milk cow. She would also like to have a modern home, with electricity and running water. Bendera says, "I like KOMAZA because they are really giving people opportunity to develop."

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Mwenda's Group

texts.en: Mwenda is a thirty-year-old mother of ten children. She resorts to burning charcoal and relies heavily on relief services to support her family. Mwenda also works on other people's farms to earn money, but the availability of this work is seasonal. Mwenda joined the KOMAZA microforesty program because "the project design guarantees future support for her children's education." She says the profits she will get from her tree farm will "enable her to feed her family well."

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Billy works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Billy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam originally comes from Kompong Speu province. She is 36 years old and married with four single children. She earns a living by farming rice alongside with her husband, who always gives her great support. Sam has been involved in rice husbandry for almost 20 years. Currently, two of her children are employed and help their family financially.

Sam is working tirelessly toward the attainment of having proper accommodation for her family. As of now, she would like to build a house to provide her family suitable living conditions. This is going to cost a lot and she has inadequate capital for this construction. In this regard, she is borrowing USD 1,500 to cover the operating costs of it. She hopes that loans will be granted to her to gradually develop her family. She is very happy and thankful for your financial support.

loans.use: to cover the operating costs of housing construction.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 45 years old and married with five children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and manages a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in this business for more than six years and earns 25,000 PHP every month. 

Allan joined GDMPC in the year 2007. He has now requested a loan of 31,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and pay the registration fee on his motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay the registration fee on his motorcycle.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 33 years old and married with two children.

Elvira is in the agricultural business. She raises livestock in the Philippines. Elvira has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her cows.

Elvira has been raising livestock for three years now. She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her cows.

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en: Jayson is 34 years old and single. He has managed a piggery business for almost two years. With this business he is earning a net income of PHP 5,000 per hog. He would like a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise. His income usually goes to cover his daily expenditures, and he is hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that his business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed and hogs to raise

loans.name: Everlina

texts.en:
Everlina is 33 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Everlina has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Everlina has requested a loan of PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries such as soap, sugar, shampoo, and other miscellaneous items.

In the future, Everlina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as soap, sugar, shampoo, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung was born in 1981. She has three daughters. Her oldest daughter is a secondary school pupil. Her two younger children are learning in kindergarten. Dung's husband is a building worker. His income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. 

Dung has a grocery store to earn a living. She has done this job for 10 years. Her income is about 6,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.

Dung has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last loan cycle she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy noodles, snacks, and soft drinks to sell in her grocery store. She always wants to save more money to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, snacks, and soft drinks to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Galulolo

texts.en:
Galulolo is 32 years old and married with six children. She has a small garden where she grows vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. 

Galulolo needs a loan to pay for her children's education and to buy new equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Galulolo will use the profits from her sales to provide for her family's daily need.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and buy fertilizer, chemicals, gloves, and a wheel barrow,.

loans.name: Luisita

texts.en:
Luisita is 49 years old, married, and has five children.  She earns a living by selling livestock in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income selling vegetables.

Luisita is requesting a loan from NWTF for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional livestock to sell.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg is a 50-year-old female head of the family who lives with her 2 sons in a small house in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her sons work at local companies. 

Altantsetseg has been working as a saleswoman since 2003, and she has gained a lot of experience in the retail business and built a close relationship with suppliers and customers over the years. 

She has just started her own business of stationery sales in a local market and now is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to purchase inventory for her new business. She is a hardworking, diligent and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her new stationery sales business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Grace works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She has been in this business for 5 years. In the future Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Tiborcio

texts.en: Tiborcio is a fisherman from CPG, Bohol. He is a married man and has eight children. Tiborcio has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. Tiborcio is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and floaters. With this loan, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and floaters.

loans.name: Dama's Group

texts.en: Dama is a 69-year-old dry-land farmer. Her agricultural endeavors face the harsh challenges of drought due to minimal rainfall in the area. Dama is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that she may build a good home with the profits from her tree farm.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Fogalele

texts.en: Fogalele is a 48-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows yams, bananas, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Fogalele has request a loan to provide her business with new equipment. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Fogalele hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, gloves, bush knives, and a mist blower

loans.name: Tanya

texts.en: Tanya is a 30-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Tanya has requested a loan to buy new equipment for her farming work. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Tanya hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, shovels, bush knives, and gloves

loans.name: Irine's Group

texts.en: Irine is a forty-year-old small-scale farmer and mother of six children. Her agricultural endeavors face the challenges presented by unreliable rainfall. Irine plans to use the profits from her tree farm to continue educating her six children, all of whom are currently in school. Her favorite part of the KOMAZA microforestry program is "making more friends and getting the spirit of working in groups."

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Charo's Group

texts.en: Charo is a 68-year-old father of three; he is a dry-land farmer and casual laborer. The odd jobs he is able to find do not pay much. Charo is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that he may educate his children with the profits from his tree farm. His favorite parts of the KOMAZA program are "getting to know many people and enjoying learning new skills." Charo aspires to be a role model in his community and foresees being financially successful from his tree farm as a means for achieving this.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional vegetable to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

Marieta has been in this business for 20 years. Marieta earns more income from her general store.

Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 50 years of age and a single mother. She has one child and they are currently residing in the village of Dadap. She has been managing a tailoring business in their village for almost 15 years, earning a net income of about Php 15,000 a month. She would like a loan amounting to Php 20,000 to  purchase needed materials for her business, such as threads, pin cushions, pins, laces, and needles. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase needed materials for her business, such as threads, pin cushions, pins, laces, and needles.

loans.name: Enkhnasan

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhnasan, 47 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son is a student, and in his free time he helps his parents by running an automobile repair shop. 

Enkhnasan and her husband have been running their own automobile repair shop for thirteen years, generating their only income. Before doing this business, she had been renting a food stall to local people, and at the same time she had been peddling. Her husband was a driver at a private business entity before shifting into working in the automobile repair shop. Her husband mainly does mechanical operations, while she does easier jobs such as painting, cleaning and reviewing the automobiles. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to complete their unfinished automobile repair shop by installing a door and a roof. As a result, the family can run two automobile repair shops simultaneously, thus increasing their work productivity and generating more income. Enkhnasan is a hardworking and polite individual whose great charisma and communication skills have attracted quite a number of customers to her business. She has already accumulated a vast amount of experience in this service field.

loans.use: to install a door and a roof on their automobile repair shop.

loans.name: Ma. Flor

texts.en:
Ma. Flor is 41 years old and has four children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Ma. Flor is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Flor requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Flor has been pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig fattening business.

In the future, Ma. Flor would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang was born in 1968. She has four children. Her oldest daughter has graduated from school. Two other daughters are studying at university or in high school. Her son is learning at primary school. Her husband is a guard. His income is about 3,000,000 VND per month. 

Hang is a farmer. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 20 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,374,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,682,000 VND to buy feed for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en:
Kuch is a farmer from Kompong Speu province. He is 34 years old and a father of two school-aged children. He owns a few plots of farmland where he and his spouse grow and harvest rice for their livelihood. Kuch has been engaged in farming for more than 10 years.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a USD $400 loan to buy a cow for the maintenance of his rice paddy. He expects a boost in his income through a reduction in operating costs. Someday, Kuch hopes to continuously improve his harvest and save for his family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy a cow for the maintenance of his rice paddy.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is a 52-year-old woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Epenesa has requested a loan to get new equipment. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Epenesa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to get a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, shovels and gloves.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia is a 40-year-old woman who is married with six children. She runs a business selling goods in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. 

Sesilia has requested a loan to purchase more goods to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to save in her account for her kids' education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, rice flour, snacks, soft drinks and clothes.

loans.name: Anania

texts.en:
Anania is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming root crops. Anania is borrowing 14000 PHP through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell.

Anania has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth lives in Amulung. She is 48 years old and married with children. Maribeth is a vendor who sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her village. 

Maribeth patiently sells vegetables to earn an income for her family. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy cabbages, eggplants, tomatoes and beans to sell. This will help increase her profits so she can pay for her children's education and uplift the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, eggplants, tomatoes and beans to sell.

loans.name: Dilshad Barkat

texts.en:
Dilshad is a supplier of embroidery materials in the area of Punjab, Pakistan. He belongs to a poor family and he is the only person earning an income in the family. He is a father of three children. He believes in hard work and honesty. 

Presently Dilshad is interested in purchasing embroidery materials including laces, buttons, and a variety of threads. Therefore he has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He wants to increase his business in the future. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase laces, buttons, and a variety of threads to sell.

loans.name: Kawangwa's Group

texts.en: Kawangwa is a 33-year-old mother of seven children and a dry-land farmer. Her agriculture faces the challenge of drought due to minimal rainfall, and therefore yields low harvests. Kawangwa is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that she may educate her children with the profits from her tree farm. She would also like to start a business with the money she earns.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren, 44 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife has been working as a service manager at restaurant since 2010. His elder daughter, 19 years old, studies at university and his younger daughter, 11 years old, is a fourth grade student.  Myagmarsuren has been providing taxi service to local people and has accumulated a vast amount of experience such as where to pick up his customers and what roads are shorter to drive. 

Myagmarsuren is requesting a loan of 6,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials including to pebbles, cement, a door, vacuum insulated windows, and hardwood floors. These building materials will be used for completing his summer house. The main advantage of completing this house is that it will enable the family to live in a place with clean air, as well as improve his family’s living standard. In Ulaanbaatar, air pollution levels are above the standard and this house is far away from the city and will provide his family with necessary clean air. Myagmarsuren is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as cement, vacuum insulated windows, and hardwood floors

loans.name: Behilder

texts.en:
Behilder is 41 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fish stall, selling items such as shrimp and crabs in the local community, which she has been doing for over six years.  She earns 15,000 PHP a month. 

Behilder is requesting a loan from GDMPC for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional shrimps and crabs to sell.  She wants to make improvements to her house and to the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shrimps and crabs to sell.

loans.name: Salama's Group

texts.en:
Salama is 25 years old and has three children. She operates a kiosk to earn money for her family, but faces the challenge of having many people who owe her money. 

Salama is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because she wants to be like the other farmers in her surrounding area who are already growing trees with KOMAZA. She intends to use the profits from her tree farm to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Soloi

texts.en: Soloi is 19 years old, married, and has two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice cakes in her community. To do so, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a cooler, foam cups, sugar, etc. In the future, Soloi hopes to improve her business and to save for her children's future. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, foam cups, and a cooler.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Prescila is 34 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom are in school.

Prescila is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. Prescila has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig raising business.

In the future, Prescila would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ianeta

texts.en:
Ianeta is a 40-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Ianeta has requested a loan to purchase more farming tools and chemicals to expand her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Ianeta hopes to save for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase bush knives, shovels, and a wheel barrow..

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi vit avec son conjoint et leurs trois enfants à Lomé.  L’ainé est âgé de 23ans, le dernier de 02ans est scolarisé.  Elle est coiffeuse de profession et en même temps revendeuse de produits cosmétiques. Avec son premier prêt qu’elle sollicite de WAGES, elle achètera des produits cosmétiques (lait pour le corps, défrisant….). Le profit tiré de la vente lui permettra d’augmenter la taille de l’activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Elle a une ancienneté d’01 an et est âgée de 40ans.
texts.en: Akouavi lives with her husband and their three children in Lomé. The eldest of her children is 23 years old and the youngest is two and at school. She is a hairdresser by trade and at the same time sells cosmetics. With this first loan she is requesting from WAGES she is going to buy beauty products (body milk, hair straightening lotion...). The profits she makes from her sales will enable her to build up her business and improve her family's living conditions. She has been a customer for a year and is 40 years old.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of 13 children, Wilma works hard to support her family. She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  

Wilma is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more firewood to resell. Wilma has sustained her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to resell.

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is 52 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school.  

Susie is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs. Susie has been pig fattening for nine years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina is a 24-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Sosefina has requested a loan to purchase more farming tools and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Sosefina hopes to save money for family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase bush knives, a wheel barrow, fertilizers, and shovels.

loans.name: Marie Justine

texts.fr:
Marie Justine est une dame âgée de 38 ans qui mène comme activité la culture de palmier à huile et l'élevage de poisson dans un étang. concrètement elle cultive les palmiers à huile et après récolte des noix de palme, elle les transforme elle même en huile de palme destinée à la vente. elle extrait de l'huile manuellement, ce qui non seulement lui prend beaucoup de temps mais également ne lui permet pas de produire en grande quantité. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter un pressoir mécanique qui lui permettra d'extraire facilement de l'huile, mais va aussi augmenter sa capacité de production.
les revenus lui permettront de mieux assurer l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie Justine is a 38-year-old woman who  cultivates palm oil and pond-raises fish. 

Specifically, she cultivates palm trees. And after harvesting the nuts, she makes them into palm oil [that she can] sell. She extracts the oil manually, which not only takes a lot of time but also does not allow her to make a large quantity. 

With this loan, she would like to buy a mechanical press. This will allow her to easily extract the oil which will increase her production capacity. 

The earnings will allow her to better ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a mechanical press

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme âgée de quarante six ans. Elle est mariée à un mécanicien. Elle a quatre enfants. Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend des produits maraîchers pour tous clients. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé et travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes. Ablavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits maraichers. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer un avenir heureux à sa famille.
texts.en: Ablavi is a 46-year old woman and is married to a mechanic. She has four children. She has been working as a retailer since 2000 and sells marketing gardening produce to all sorts of customers. She buys her products at Lomé's Grand Market and works alone. Her main problem at the moment is not being able to satisfy all her customer demand. She has requested her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy market gardening produce. She wants to reinvest in her business and in the coming years she would like to expand this business. She says that she is planning to ensure a happy future for her family with the profits.

loans.use: to buy market gardening produce.

loans.name: Faamita

texts.en: Faamita is 22 years old and married with one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling Elei (fabric printing) materials in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy materials, paints, stencils, boards, etc. In the future, Faamita hopes to save for her child's future and to improve her business. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, paints, design board, and stencils.

loans.name: Kadzo's Group

texts.en: Kadzo is a forty-eight year old mother of eight children. She operates a food kiosk to earn money to support her family, but has many customers with unpaid debts. Kadzo intends to use the profits from her tree farm to purchase a piece of land as an investment for her family. She anticipates the KOMAZA program will allow her to "live a stable life and enjoy the fruits of her hard work."

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi est une jeune dame de 32ans. Elle a pour conjoint un transitaire et ont des enfants en charge. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle revend des produits congelés et s’approvisionne chez les grossistes. Son second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui servira d’acheter plus de marchandises. Le profit tiré de la vente lui servira d’élargir son marché et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Akouavi is a young woman of 32 years. She has a husband who is a freight forwarder. She also has some children. To help her husband with the household expenses, she resells frozen food products that she procures from wholesalers. 

This second loan that she is asking for will help her buy more product. 

The profit earned from the sales will help her expand her market and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy frozen food products

loans.name: Sasa

texts.en:
Sasa is 23 years old and single, with no children. She wants to start a small business, making and selling ice cakes in her community. 

To do this, she needs a loan to buy foam cups, sugar, and a cooler. In the future, Sasa hopes to save her profit to maintain her business and for the betterment of her family. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, sugar, and a cooler for her business.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 43 years old, married, and has three children. 

Viola is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Viola requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional piglets to raise, along with feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Viola has been raising pigs for nine years now and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Viola would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise, along with feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alofisa

texts.en:
Alofisa is a 45-year-old, married woman, with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Alofisa has requested a loan to purchase more farming tools and chemicals to expand her business. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011. With her profits, Alofisa hopes to save in her account for family needs.

loans.use: to buy farming tools and chemicals for her plantation.

loans.name: Betty Esther

texts.es: Betty de 46 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Malambo con su cónyuge y su hija de 13 años. Allí tiene un negocio donde vende mercancía variada  en un punto que habilitó en su domicilio. Sus principales productos son el calzado, accesorios femeninos, la ropa interior y la ropa exterior. Desde hace 24 años Betty inició su actividad comercial, vendiendo mercancía a trabajadores de la empresa donde trabajara su padre. Poco  a poco hizo su propio capital y fue invirtiendo en enseres y vitrinas para exhibir la mercancía. Sus ventas las realiza principalmente de contado desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche a sus principales clientes, que son sus vecinos del barrio y otros sectores, quienes conocen la calidad de sus artículos y se han incrementado. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará calzado y ropa interior, que son las mercancías que tienen una mayor rotación y que necesita tener un inventario permanente de ellas. Betty    con su anterior crédito logró surtir mucho más el local y agregarle nuevas mercancías ajustadas a cada época comercial, su capacidad de trabajo y disciplina es lo que hace que su credikiva tenga mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Betty, forty-six, lives in the town of Malambo with her partner and thirteen-year-old daughter.  She set up a store in part of her house where she sells a variety of merchandise, mainly shoes, women's accessories, undergarments and outerwear.  She started the business twenty-four years ago selling merchandise to employees at the company where her father worked.  Little by little she got her own capital and invested in the supplies and showcases to display her wares. She sells for cash from 8AM to 8PM to her main clients, her neighbors from her own and nearby neighborhoods, who know the quality of her items.  Clientele has grown, which is exactly why she is seeking a Kiva loan, her second with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She'll buy shoes and undergarments, which have high turnover so she needs a steady inventory.  

With her prior loan, Betty was able to stock up her store a lot more and add merchandise for every sales season.  Her capacity for work and discipline is what has allowed her have so much success with her Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy shoes and undergarments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Edilma María

texts.es:
Edilma es ama de casa, digna de admiración y respeto, con su esfuerzo y perseverancia ha logrado salir adelante. Cuenta que su vida no ha sido fácil, debido a que su esposo la abandonó y debió asumir las responsabilidades del hogar y velar por el bienestar de sus cuatro hijos. A pesar de la difícil situación económica que Edilma afrontó, su esperanza nunca se extinguió y  sus hijos se convirtieron en el factor fundamental para salir adelante. 
Gracias a la colaboración de su madre, comenzó con su proyecto de empresa, creando una pequeña legumbrería en su vivienda y gracias a la demanda de sus clientes ha ido creciendo hasta ofrecer productos de la canasta familiar.
Hoy Edilma es una mujer agradecida con Dios y con la vida por la oportunidad concedida para montar su propio negocio y garantizarles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades educativas.
Con el propósito de ver crecer su negocio y estabilizar su condición económica, Edilma se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de surtido, ya que sueña con ver crecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Edilma is a housewife, worthy of admiration and respect. With her efforts and perseverance she has managed to get ahead. Edilma tells us that her life has not been easy, due to the fact that her husband abandoned her and she had to assume all responsibilities for the home and the well-being of her 4 children. Despite the difficult economic situation that Edilma confronted, her hope was never extinguished and her children became the fundamental factor in her desire to get ahead.

Thanks to the collaboration of her mother, Edilma began her entrepreneurial project, creating a small vegetable store in her home. And thanks to customer demand, the business has been growing, to the point where she now offers the products that make up the family basket. 

Today Edilma is a woman grateful to God for her life with this opportunity available to build her own business and to guarantee her children a good quality of life and better educational opportunities.

With the proposition of seeing her business grow and her economic condition stabilize, Edilma is requesting a loan for the purpose of purchasing a selection of merchandise, as she dreams of seeing her store grow.

loans.use: to purchase products included in the family basket for her small store.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
La señora Juana María es casada de 34 años de edad curso los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la artesania, especificamente a tejer cortes tipicos. Inicio este negocio con sus padres y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores para poder tejer los cortes. en el futuro quiere que este capital a invertir crezca y que su negocio tambien vaya creciendo.
texts.en:
Juana María is thirty-four, married, and has six years of elementary school education.  She has six children, five of whom are in school.  She works as an artisan, making traditional clothing.  She started the business with her parents and now has ten years of experience. 

Juana María is seeking a loan to buy threads in different colors to weave clothing.  In the future she would like her capital to grow so the business can keep growing, too.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Uaina

texts.en: Uaina is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling handicrafts such as baskets, fans, mats, etc. in her community. To do this, she is requesting a loan to buy bandanas, paints, feathers, bamboos, etc. In the future, Uaina hopes to extend her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase feathers, bamboos, bandanas, and paints.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida con su credikiva encontró una oportunidad de comercializar sabanas, pues compró al por mayor y vendió a buen precio rotando su capital de trabajo rápidamente y volviendo a invertir en materias primas e insumos. Con sus nuevos ingresos ha logrado apoyar la gestión de su hogar en manos de su esposo. En la actualidad está elaborando pulsos de madera y fruteras en totumos estas son una nueva modalidad en sus artesanías con las que le ha ido muy bien, porque le ha generado pedidos. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva,  que lo invertirá en ropa de cama, mercado que se encuentra en exploración y con el que le ha ido muy bien. Esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva resulte ser exitoso.
texts.en:
With her Kiva loan Zoraida found the opportunity to sell sheets.  She bought wholesale, sold for a good price, turned over her working capital quickly, and reinvested in raw materials and supplies.

With her new income she has managed to help her husband with the household management.  She is currently making wooden bracelets and fruit plates.  These are a new style of crafts, which have gone very well for her.  This is because it has generated orders.

She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy bedding.  The market is exploratory, and it has gone very well for her.  This is exactly what makes her Kiva loan successful.

loans.use: to buy bedding in greater volume.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
JUAN CARLOS tiene 32 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive junto a la esposa y los hijos en la ciudad de Chimbo Provincioa de Bolívar.

JUAN CARLOS se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos, polvillo, vacunas.
Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar los animales y la alimentación. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Guaranda.
El sueño es comprar un automovil. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la estabilidad del trabajo.
En el tiempo libre le gustaría seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is thirty-two and married with two children.  He lives with his wife and children in the city of Chimbo in Bolivar Province.

He earns his living buying and selling pigs.  He is seeking a loan to buy pigs, feed, and vaccines.  With help from the loan he'll be able to buy the animals and feed.  He makes his purchases in the city of Guaranda.   

Juan Carlos's dream is to buy a car.  His challenge is the stability of his work.  In his free time he would like to keep going to school.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the leader of Josephine's Group. She is a 42-year-old mother of five children and a teacher. She appreciates the value of education and is currently sending all of her children to school. 

Josephine intends to use the profits from her KOMAZA loan for her tree farm and to further her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is 34 years old and married with four children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes, and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Yvonne needs a loan to purchase more veggie seeds and tools to expand her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Yvonne will use the profits from her sales to save for family needs.

loans.use: to buy veggie seeds, fertilizers, shovels, a bush knife, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Hermione

texts.en: Hermione is 42 years old and single with two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling drinks and snacks in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more drinks, snacks such as chips, cookies, hot dogs, etc. In the future, Hermione hopes to save her profit for her children's education and to extend her business. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chips, cookies, hot dogs, and coca cola.

loans.name: Pele

texts.en: Pele is a 42 years old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase more farming tools and chemicals to expand her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Pele hopes to save for her business needs.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, fertilizers, and shovels.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca, de 30 años, es una joven mujer que tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante trabajando, es conviviente con Jilder con quien tiene 03 hijos de 14, 10 y 05 años, vive cómodamente en su casa propia junto a su familia.EL trabajo de Blanca consiste en el venta de pescado, desde temprano por la mañana sale en busca de pescado fresco en el mercado de la ciudad, de ahí lleva sus productos hasta la casa del padre de su esposo como es una zona muy concurrida, pone afuera su mesa y espera a que los clientes lleguen en busca de pescado fresco y bueno. Lleva realizando este trabajo por un año aproximadamente, hace su trabajo sola ya que su pareja trabaja en otro departamento del Perú desde donde le manda alguna ayuda económica.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder estar en su casa haciendo otras actividades por la tarde, además todos los días hay buenos ingresos ya que tiene buenas ganancias, espera poder mantenerse y quizá más adelante poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.Por tanto éste será el primer préstamo con Kiva y agradece la oportunidad que le brindan de poder aumentar su capital de trabajo ya que así le genera mayor ganancia.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará pescado fresco, además comprará algunas bandejas y materiales para poder vender mas cómoda y sin complicaciones.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 30 year old young woman who has a great desire to get ahead by working.  She is in a common-law marriage with Jilder.  They have three children, ages 14, 10, and 5.  She lives comfortably with her family in their own house.

Blanca’s work is selling fish.  She leaves early in the morning to look for fresh fish at the city market.  From there she takes the products to her father in-law’s house, which is in a very busy area.  She sets up her table outside, and she waits for the customers to come looking for good, fresh fish.  She has been doing this work for approximately one year.  She works alone because her life partner works in another department in Perú.  He does send her some financial help from there.

What she likes about her work is that it gives her time to be able to be at her house doing other activities in the afternoon.  Also, every day there is good income.  She hopes to be able to maintain it and perhaps, later on, set up a grocery store at her house.  

This will be her first loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the opportunity given to her in order to be able to increase her working capital.  This will generate greater income.

She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy fresh fish.  She will also buy some trays and materials in order to be able to sell more comfortably and without difficulties.

loans.use: to buy fish and plastic trays.

loans.name: Pety.

texts.fr: Pety. est une jeune femme âgée de 30 ans qui, comme activité depuis 04 ans, gère un salon de coiffure dans laquelle elle vend également des produits cosmétiques. le stock de produits qu'elle dispose en permanence ne lui permettant pas de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle, elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des mèches, greffes, champoing, huile de beauté, vernis afin de le renforcer. ce qui lui permettra par conséquent d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. elle a pour ambition d'ouvrir un grand institut de beauté.
texts.en: Pety is a young woman who is 30 years of age and who has been running her hairdressing salon for the past four years. She also sells cosmetics from her shop. Pety has been unable to maintain the inventory that she desires in order to properly satisfy her customers. She wants to use this loan to buy hair extensions, shampoo, beauty oil, and nail polish so that she can better serve her customers. This will allow Pety to increase the income she earns. Her ambition is to open a large beauty parlor.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Emmanuel's Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is the leader of Emmanuel's Group. He is a 65-year-old, small-scale, dryland farmer and the father of eight children. His farming is challenged by persistent drought. 

Emmanuel intends to invest in his farming business and purchase land with the profits from his KOMAZA loan. His favorite aspects of the KOMAZA microforestry program are interacting with the field staff and working in a farmer group.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Soo

texts.en: Soo is 64 years old and married with 11 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling cookies in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, oil, etc. In the future, Soo hopes to extend her business for the betterment of her family. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, yeast.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his shoe store.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Maria Fe has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maria Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for more meat needed in her business.

loans.name: Kadzo's Group

texts.en: Kadzo is a 35-year-old dryland farmer and mother of three children. Her husband is a farmer too, and their maize growing is negatively affected by drought and pests. Kadzo is joining the KOMAZA micro-forestry program so that she may educate her children and improve the family home with the profits from her tree farm.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Faaaloalo

texts.en:
Faaaloalo is 43 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Faaaloalo has requested a loan to purchase more fishing gear and nets to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faaaloalo will save for her kids education .

loans.use: to buy fishing gear, fishing nets, and a canoe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his spice booth.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old, married, and has five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She also earns additional income raising pigs.

Rosalie is requesting her third loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as shampoo, soap, spices, canned goods, etc. to sell.  She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, spices, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Uanona

texts.en:
Uanona is 26 years old and married with two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling drinks and snacks in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more soft drinks, cookies, chips, buns, sausages and other items. 

In the future, Uanona hopes to save for her kids' education and the betterment of her family. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cookies, chips, buns, Coca-Cola, Sprite, and Fanta.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell, including canned goods, bread, snacks, coffee, milk, soap, shampoo and more.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. Thelma is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soft drinks, can goods, spices, sugar, and milk.

Thelma has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her general store business.

In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, spices, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace her roof.

loans.name: Dmytryi

texts.ru:
Дмитрий занимается тепличным бизнесом, выращивая помидоры и огурцы на своем участке в селе Водяное. В этой сфере он занят уже 12 лет. Имеет три участка земли. Доход с огорода составляет 350 000 гривен. 
Дмитрию понадобилась дополнительная финансовая помощь в размере 24 000 гривен  для того, чтобы установить отопление в теплицах и приобрести отопительный котел. На следующий год Дмитрий хочет утеплить теплицы, чтобы высаживать овощи еще раньше. В прошлом году с ним случилось несчастье — когда фрезеровал огород, зацепился рукавом за мотофрезу и она потащила его по земле, ударился головой об трубу теплицы, потерял сознание, очнулся уже в больнице в Запорожье. Потратили на лечение 60 000 гривен, хорошо что обошлось без последствий. Авария случилась как раз весной, когда было много работы на огороде, он не мог работать, помогали друзья. Но все равно запоздал урожай, пришлось продавать машину. В этом году уже все нормально, приобрели другое авто, продолжает работать.
texts.en: Dmytryi's business is working with greenhouses, growing tomatoes and cucumbers on his own land in the village of Vodyanoye.  This has been his profession for 12 years.  He has three plots of land.  The  income from his garden is around 350,000 griven annually.  Dmytryi needs a loan of 24,000 griven to install heating in his greenhouses and to purchase a boiler.  Next year, he wants to use his heated greenhouses to plant vegetables earlier.  Last year an unfortunate mishap landed Dmytryi in the hospital when his sleeve caught in his motorized ground-tiller.  It dragged him along the ground and he hit his head on a pipe and lost consciousness.  He woke up in hospital in Kiev.  Although he had to spend 60,000 griven on his recovery, he's fortunate to not have any permanent damage.  This accident unfortunately happened during the spring, when there was much work to be done in the garden that he was not able to do.  Although his friends helped, the crop was too late and Dmytryi had to sell his car.  This year is much better.  He has purchase another car and continues to work.

loans.use: To install heating in his greenhouses and to purchase a boiler.

loans.name: Jaliwa's Group

texts.en:
Jaliwa is a sixty-year-old dryland farmer. His agricultural endeavors suffer from long drought periods. 

Jaliwa is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program "to improve his livelihood and the environment." He intends to use the profits from his tree farm to improve his farming techniques and build a permanent home. 

Jaliwa appreciates the interaction he has with other farmers and learning new methods of tree maintenance through the KOMAZA program.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Ailua

texts.en:
Ailua is a 36-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plant to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Ailua has requested a loan to purchase more equipment to expand her plantation. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. 

With her profits, Ailua hopes to save for her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, a wheel barrow, and bush knives.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 57 years old and has seven children. She is married and 3 of her children are in school.

Marcela is in the agricultural business of raising cows in the Philippines. Marcela requested a loan of 29500 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional cow to raise.

Marcela has been raising cows for 8 years now and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marcela would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow to raise.

loans.name: Sidi's Group

texts.en: Sidi is a 31-year-old mother of four children and dryland farmer. She grows maize and peas, and keeps goats. Her agricultural endeavors are challenged by drought. Sidi is joining the KOMAZA micro-forestry program so that she may build a house and install running water with the profits from her tree farm.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock to sell, including canned goods, snacks, beverages, coffee, milk and more.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: Don Mario un humilde comerciante, de 50 años de edad, se dedica a la carpintería. Su primer préstamo kiva fue de mucha ayuda pues llego cuando mas lo necesitaba, le permitió invertir mas en su negocio, comprando barniz, pintura, lija, madera, pegamento. Ahora esta necesitando su segundo financiamiento  para comprar madera por mayor para la elaboración de sus muebles como sillas, mesas, ropero, para  diversificar aun más su negocio, dentro de sus planes futuros es ampliar su taller para brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Don Mario is an unassuming businessman. He is 50 years old and a carpenter. His first KIVA loan helped him greatly because it arrived when he most needed it. It enabled him to invest more in his business by buying varnish, paint, sandpaper, and adhesive material. Now he needs his second funding in order to buy wood wholesale so that he can make furniture, such as chairs, tables and wardrobes, and diversify his business even more.

One of his future plans is to expand his shop so that he can provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase wood wholesale.

loans.name: Munojot

texts.ru:
Муночот жительница города Исфара. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и имеет одного сына. Ее муж в данное время находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. А сын работает в предпиятии помощником мастера по капитальному ремонту.
Муночот тоже наравне мужа и сына работает и обеспечивает семью. Она арендует столовую, где готовит и предоставляет национальные блюда своим посетителям. Муночот работает поваром в течение 8 лет и уже имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. Чтобы привлечь больше клиентов и расширить свой бизнес, Муночот хочет провести ремонт в своей столовой и увеличить ассортимент блюд. С этим намерением она просит кредит для ремонта своей столовой и приобретения необходимых продуктов.
texts.en: Munojot is a resident of the city Isfara.  She's 47 years old, married and has one son.  Her husband is currently in Russia working to send money home to his family.  Her son works as an assistant foreman on major construction.  Munojot work to provide for the family just like her husband and son.  She rents a dining room where she prepares and offers national food dishes to her visitors.  She has worked as a cook for 8 years and has much experience in this profession.  In order to attract more customers and expand her business, Mynojot wants to make repairs to her dining room and expand her menu.  With this intent, she is asking for a loan to help her make the needed repairs and purchase necessary products.

loans.use: To repair dining room and to purchase necessary products.

loans.name: Talisuaga

texts.en: Talisuaga is a 39-year-old woman who is married with two children. She has a small business running a taxi. She has had this business for three years. Talisuaga needs a loan to purchase new spare tyres, cover seats and floor mats. She will use her profits to save for family needs. Talisuaga joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase cover seats, floor mats, and spare tyres

loans.name: Yasir Shahzad

texts.en:
Mr. Yasir Shahzad has been running a small garment shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is the only source of income for his family. He sells a variety of pants and shirts in his shop. He has one son. His wife is a housewife.
