Mr. Yasir Shahzad has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan he will purchase a variety of shirts, pants, and ties. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of  shirts, pants, and ties

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 50 years old and married with 8 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling snacks in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy buns, cookies, hot dogs, coca cola, and bongo (Samoan chips). 

Luisa joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services. 

In the future, Luisa hopes to use her profits to improve her business and for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy cookies, buns, hot dogs, coca cola, and bongo.

loans.name: Gautaala

texts.en:
Gautaala is 52 years old and married with six children. She makes and sells elei designing items (for traditional fabric printing) to earn a living and has been doing this for four years.

Gautaala has requested a loan to purchase working equipment and tools. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase design board, materials and paints.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is married. She is 34 years old and has four children, three of whom are in school.

Erma is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Erma requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Erma has been raising livestock for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Erma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora, de 20 años, es una mujer amable y muy carismática, esta casada y es madre de un niño de 03 años , tiene su casa propia en donde habita junto a toda su familia.El trabajo de Dora consiste en la compra de racimos de plátano de las comunidades alrededor de la ciudad. Luego los vende desde su casa y en algunas ocasiones sale a venderlos en la calle, entre sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, siempre tiene plátanos frescos y de muy buena calidad. Lleva trabajando con esta actividad un promedio de 03 años .Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede contar con un ingreso extra y así apoya a la economía de su hogar, lo considera rentable por que sus productos tienen una buena demanda, espera seguir creciendo con este trabajo ya que le esta ayudando a mejorar muchos aspectos de su vida.Por tanto éste será el préstamo numero 01 con Kiva, agradece mucho a la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le ayudará a continuar con su trabajo.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, comprará plátanos en mayor cantidad para después revenderlos, además invertirá en comprar frutas que es lo que piensa agregar a su venta diaria.
texts.en:
Dora, 20 years old, is a friendly and very charismatic woman. She is married and the mother of a three-year-old son. She lives with her family in her own home. Her work consists of purchasing bunches of plantains from the communities surrounding the city. Then she sells them from her home and at times she sells them on the street to her neighbors, friends and relatives. She always has fresh, high-quality plantains. She has run this business for about three years. She enjoys her work because she can earn extra income and thus contribute to household expenses. She believes it is profitable because her products are in high demand. She hopes to continue expanding her business because it is helping her to improve many aspects of her life.

This will be her first loan from KIVA and she is very grateful for the help provided because it will help her to continue with her business. With the sum of S/. 1,000 she has requested, she will buy plantains in greater quantities and then re-sell them. She will also purchase fruit to add to her daily sales.

loans.use: to purchase plantains and regional fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items for the kitchen and more chairs.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 48 years old. She is married and has four children. She runs a general store and has sold food she prepares for the past 14 years. 

Remedios is applying for a loan of 15000 PHP in her seventh cycle with NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loans. She will use this loan to buy groceries for her store, as well as the ingredients for the food she sells.

Remedios's store continues to provide her and her family with an income that improves their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Arlett Del Socorro

texts.es: Arlett con su previo credikiva compró cervezas gaseosas y una carpa, Ahora su negocio luce más cómodo y puede trabajar protegida del sol y de la lluvia. Su nueva carpa le ha generado la oportunidad de alquilarla en el momento en el cual no está trabajando en ella y eso le representa un nuevo ingreso. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará   cervezas gaseosas por cajas y una planta eléctrica para el negocio. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje  a Kiva:  ”Señores financiadores, ojalá continúen con esta labor y estamos agradecidos por ayudarme a mi y a mi familia para progresar en mi negocio.
texts.en: Arlett bought beers, fizzy drinks and a marquee with her last Kiva loan.  Now her business looks more comfortable and she can work under protection from the sun and rain.  She can also rent out the marquee when she is not working and this provides her with another source of income.  She is currently applying for another Kiva loan that she will use to buy crates of beers and fizzy drinks and a generator for the business.  Arlett sends this message to Kiva: "Dear investors, I hope you continue with this work.  We are very grateful that you are helping and my family to progress in the business".

loans.use: to buy crates of fizzy drinks and beers and a power generator for her business.

loans.name: Chupop Abaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Odilia es casada de 39 años de edad, curso 3 años de educacion primaria , tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 estan estudiando. Ella se dedica a confeccionar delantales, inicio este negocio confeccionando con maquinas simples y hasta la fecha lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para soliocitar un prestamo que lo urilizara para compra de materiales para poder realizar los delantales, como tela, lustrina de diferentes colores, etc. en el futuro espera quiere tener un gran capital y que vaya creciendo su negocio. Las demas integrantes tambien se dedican a confeccionar delantales y vender cosmeticos.
texts.en:
Odilia is 39 years old and married.  She completed three years of primary education.  She has five children, three of whom are in education.  Odilia makes a living making aprons.  She started this business making them with simple machines and she now has 15 years of experience.

Odilia is organising a group to apply for a loan that she will use to buy materials to make the aprons, such as material and different coloured cloths.  In the future she hopes to have a lot of capital and to keep expanding the business.  The other members of the group also make aprons and sell cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia, de 39 años, es una mujer muy alegre, dinámica y muy responsable, esta casada con Juan y juntos tienen cinco hijos , ella vive junto a su familia en la casa de material noble , que construyo con mucho esfuerzo.Emilia, se dedica a la venta de comida, se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado a buscar los mejores productos para la cocina, luego va a su casa a preparar los deliciosos platos que le caracterizan y motivo por el que tiene muchos  clientes, lleva aproximadamente 05 años en este negocio y trabaja sola .Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener tiempo disponible para dedicarse a su hogar, además que puede realizar algunas otras actividades, también empezó a alquilar su mototaxi y eso le genera mejoras en su economía, espera poder en adelante mejorar la infraestructura de su local y poder seguir brindando lo mejor a sus clientes.Por tanto éste será el primer préstamo con Kiva y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado ya que le ayudará a mejorar su negocio.Con los 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes tales como arroz, verduras, carnes entre otros  insumos para seguir con su venta de comida, ya que desea aumentar la variedad de comidas que ofrece en su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Emilia, 39, is a very cheerful, dynamic and very responsible woman married to Juan; they have five children.  She lives with her family in a house made of substantial materials she built with much effort.  Emilia works selling food.  She rises very early to go to the market to look for the best products to cook.  She then takes them home to prepare the delicious dishes that characterize her and which have led to her having many customers.  

She’s been in business for about five years and she works alone.  What she enjoys about her work is that it gives her free time to devote to her home.  She’s also able to do some other activities like renting out a mototaxi to generate improved income.  She hopes in future to improve her site’s infrastructure to continue providing the best for her customers.

Therefore, this will be her first Kiva loan and she’s very grateful for the support provided since it will help her improve her business.  She will use the 1,000 soles to buy ingredients like rice, vegetables and meats, among others to continue with her food sales since she hopes to increase the variety of meals she offers in her food stand.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice and meat, among others..

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She earns additional income from tailoring.

Rosalie has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She's successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her retail business.

Rosalie aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
Juan, 48 años de edad,  habitante de Pueblo Nuevo, Municipio de Estelí, padre de 3 hijos, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a  la siembra de café, es cliente kiva esta muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado, porque poco a poco gracias al  primer financiamiento obtenidos ha logrado comprar insumo agrícola y pagar mano de obra en su siembra de café, a pesar del problema con tuvo con la plaga que afecto el café logro sacar adelante su producción permitiendo cancelar el crédito y vender parte de la cosecha que no sufrió daños. 
Está requiriendo de su segundo financiamiento para seguir invirtiendo en lo mismo como es  la compra abonos, fertilizantes,plaguisidas, pagar mano de obra, unos de sus propósitos es ampliar el área de su siembras de café orgánico.
texts.en: Juan, 48, lives in Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí Municipality.  He’s the father of three children and works in agriculture; he’s a coffee grower.  He’s a Kiva client and is very grateful for the support provided because thanks to his first loan he’s been able to gradually buy farm supplies and pay labor costs for his coffee crops.  Despite the problem he had with an infestation that affected his coffee he succeeded in bringing in a harvest that allowed him to repay the loan and sell the part of the harvest that was undamaged.  He now needs a second loan to continue investing in the same way: buying fertilizer, manure, insecticide and paying labor costs.  One of his goals is to expand the size of his organic coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Maria Patricia

texts.es: Maria de 36 años de edad habita al suroccidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 12 años. Hace 2 años decidió iniciar s propio negocio de comercio de ropa interior y de cosméticos, aplicando a la metodología que promocionaban compañías mediante guías especializadas, a través de las cuales ofrecían sus artículos. Anteriormente trabajando de empleada doméstica de una familia que habitaba en un multifamiliar, logró   construí su propia clientela y con ello reunir  dinero   para invertirlo en artículos que solicitaban sus clientes,   con ello logró  ampliar su volumen de clientes y hoy solo se dedica al comercio. Su clientela crece permanentemente y su necesidad de capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responde a su demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumería cosméticos y ropa en general. Su meta de prosperidad es adquirir su propia vivienda y  por eso ella trabaja persistentemente con el fin de lograrlo.
texts.en:
Maria, 36, lives on the southwest side of the city with her husband and two children, ages  9 and 12. Two years ago, she decided to start her underwear  and cosmetics business. She sells her merchandise through specialized catalogs. Previously, she was a maid for a family that lived in a multifamily complex. She has built a client base and saved money to invest in items her customers request. She has increased volume and now works solely as a merchant. 

Her client base keeps growing, and she lacks capital to meet demand. She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy perfumes, cosmetics, and clothing. Her goal is to be prosperous and buy her own house, a goal she is working constantly to achieve.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 38 years old and married with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. 

Salome needs a loan to buy more tools to expand her business. In the future, she plans to save for her child's education. Salome joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to purchase a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, and bush knives

loans.name: Mirna Gabriela

texts.es:
Mirna tiene 21 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo de y vive con su familia en un colonia de la ciudad de San Pedro Sula Cortes.
Mirna estableció con la ayuda de su esposo un negocio de venta de comida, ofreciendo baleadas, tortillas con quesillo, pupusas mixtas, pastelitos. Con este negocio ella se ha ayudado mucho con los gastos del hogar, y ya tiene su propia clientela.
En la actualidad esta pidiendo un préstamo  de 6,000 lempiras para invertir en compra de insumos para la elaboración de las comidas, como maíz, quesillo, harina de trigo, huevos, frijoles, arroz, carne molida, papas, lacteos etc. Para surtir el negocio con los productos necesarios e incrementar sus ventas y poder ofrecer otra variedad de alimento como Pollo frito con tajadas y almuerzos. y atender tambien por pedidos a sus clientes.
La meta es establecer su negocio en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad, así sus ganancias serian invertidas en poder obtener su casa.
texts.en:
Mirna, 21, is married and has a son; she lives with her family in a neighborhood in San Pedro Sula, Cortes.  With help from her husband, Mirna opened a food stand where she sells ‘baleadas’ [flour tortillas filled with various ingredients], tortillas with cheese, mixed ‘pupusas’ [filled, grilled corn cakes] and little cakes.  This business has been a big help with household expenses since she has her own established clientele.

She’s currently asking for a 6,000 Lempira loan to buy cooking ingredients like rice, string cheese, wheat flour, eggs, beans, rice, ground meat, potatoes, dairy products, etc. to stock her business with the ingredients needed to increase sales and to offer more variety of food items like fried chicken with fried plantain and lunches and also to be able to cook for her customers to order.  Her goal is to set up her business in a centrally-located spot in the city and to invest her profits in the purchase of a house.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Karla Ivania

texts.es:
Karla, 38 años de edad, originaria de  Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Esteli, casada, madre de 2 hijos de 8 y 9 años, de oficio comerciante, se  dedica a brindar el servicio de molino, de la que es propietaria hace mas de 1 año,  debido a las condiciones económico en que vivía solo logro finalizar su segundo año de secundaria. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio a la edad de 37 años con capital propio, la cual  con dinero que tenia ahorrado, pudo comprar su primer  molino, pero a pesar de que era pequeño ella logro salir adelante con las ganancias que le genero este negocio,  cuenta con otros ingresos como es la remesa que le manda su hermano, sus expectativas es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
Karla solicita el financiamiento para comprar otro molino y disco para el molino.  Ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar todas las herramientas que necesita para su molino para poder brindar un mejor servicios a su clientela.
texts.en:
Karla, 38, was born in Pueblo Nuevo in Esteli. She is married, the mother of two children ages 8 and 9, and a merchant. She has operated a grinding service for a year. Because she lacked money, she only finished the second year of high school. At 37, she started this business with her savings. She bought her first grinder, and though it was small, she managed to get ahead on the income it generated. Her brother also sends her money, and she expects her business to grow.

Karla is applying for a loan to buy another grinder and disk. She thinks the loan will let her buy all the equipment she needs so that she can better service her customers.

loans.use: to buy a grinder and a disk for the grinder.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter's business is doing well. He is grateful to KADET LTD and Kiva lenders for the financial support he received which made it possible for him to expand his business. His monthly income has increased to KES 25,000, which he used to support his siblings.

He is applying for his second business loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more watches, belts, radios and sunglasses. He will use the anticipated profits to pay for his siblings' school fees. His hopes and dreams are to own a fully stocked retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more watches, belts, radios and sunglasses.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their other personal, household and business expenditures. 

Leonora would like to apply for another loan of 17,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leonora dreams of expanding her business until it becomes a full grocery store and hopes that her two children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 33 years of age and married, with one child. He runs a retail shop in Emali town and it has been profitable for the last two years that he has been in that business.

This being his first loan term, he plans to use the amount to buy more stocks of goods to sell. These include, sugar, salt, milk, rice, tea leaves, and matchboxes.

He hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop and, thereby, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of goods to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 55 years-old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy stocks to sell such as noodles, soap, canned goods, biscuits, etc.

Mary Jane has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell such as noodles, soap, canned goods, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Leiloa

texts.en: Leiloa is a 65 year-old married woman with eight children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, banana and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Leiloa has requested a loan in order to purchase more farming tools and chemicals to expand her business. She has been a member of Kiva partner SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Leiloa hopes to save for her children's education

loans.use: to purchase a wheel barrow, bush knives, fertilizers and shovels..

loans.name: Amanda De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Amanda de 61 años de edad, se ha convertido en un ejemplo de vida para su familia. Desde su infancia ha residido en el campo, realizando labores de ama de casa, por lo cual las oportunidades que tuvo de acceder a la educación fueron nulas. Siempre soñó con  poner a producir la tierra de la finca familiar, y generar ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de su hogar. Gracias a sus hermanos que le regalaron el capital inicial para iniciar con su idea de negocio, hoy Amanda se encuentra produciendo hortalizas. Su sueño no para acá, pues desea convertirse en la principal proveedora en el mercado de su municipio y ampliar la variedad de productos, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de semillas, abonos y una bomba de fumigación.
Espera con esta inversión mejorar la productividad en su negocio y mejorar las condiciones económicas de la familia.
texts.en:
Amanda, 61, has become a model for her family. She has lived in the countryside all her life and done the household chores. She had no opportunity to go to school. Her dream has always been to work the family farmland and earn income to make a contribution to the household expenses. Her brothers graciously gave her money to start her business. 

Amanda now has a vegetable garden. Although this was not her original dream, she wants to become the main supplier at her city market and offer a variety of produce. She is applying for a loan to buy seed, manure, and a fumigation pump. She expects this investment will increase productivity and improve her family's circumstances.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, and a fumigation pump.

loans.name: Sologa

texts.en: Sologa is a 52 year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Sologa has requested a loan in order to buy fertilizers, knives, crops and chemicals for her plantation business. She has been a member of Kiva partner SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Sologa hopes to expand her business to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, bush knives, chemicals and gloves,

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia is 55 years-old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for twoyears. Telesia has requested a loan in order to buy ingredients needed for making her pancakes. She joined Kiva partner SPBD in 2010 in order to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Telesia will expand her business in order to earn more money.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, a large cooking pot and a gas oven.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith, a 62-year-old single woman, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 11 years now. Having received six previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business, Judith has requested a new one for PHP 14000 loan to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 43 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Imelda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy fishing nets and other fishing paraphernalia.

Imelda has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to buy an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing paraphernalia.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tautineia

texts.en:
Tautineia is 52 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling banana chips in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Tautineia has requested a loan to buy ingredients needed to make banana chips for her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tautineia will expand her business to gain more income for her immediate family.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cooking oil, salts, and a large cooking pot.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura compró luces neón barras de cambio pellones, farolas calcomanías e incrementó sus inventarios y esto fue gracia a su credikiva anterior. Hoy está aplicando aun nuevo financiamiento con el cual comprará repuestos de mayor tamaño como llantas rines neumáticos baterías forros para timón con los cuales cubrirá la demanda  de su clientela. Y justamente esto es lo que hace que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa. Laura envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores:  “ su apoyo ha sido muy importante para mi crecimiento como empresaria y como comerciante, ya que actualmente tengo puertas abiertas en el comercio de partes automotriz.
texts.en:
Thanks to her previous Kiva loan, Laura bought neon lights, gear shifts, seat covers, lights and decals and increased her inventory.  Now, she’s applying for a new loan to buy larger spare parts like tires, wheel rims, inner tubes, batteries and steering wheel covers to meet customer demand which is precisely what will make her Kiva loan an successful investment.  

Laura sends the following message to lenders: “Your support has been very important for my growth as a businesswoman and merchant because I’m now open for business as an auto spare parts merchant.”

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts.

loans.name: Anacaren De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Anacaren de Jesus es soltera, tiene 24 años de edad, curso 5 años de educacion primaria , tiene 2 hijos y uno de ellos esta estudiando, ella se dedica a la tejeduria de cortes tipicos. Inicio este negocio trabajando para otra persona  y hasta la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia en el negocio.

Solicita un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales como por ejemplo hilos, conos, labores, para la elaboracion de sus tejidos. En el futuro quiere ver su negocio prospero y tener trabajadores.
texts.en: Anacaren de Jesús, 24, completed five years of elementary education.  She has two children one of which attends school.  She works knitting traditional outfits.  She started this business working with another person and to date has four years’ experience in it.  She’s requesting a loan that she’ll use to buy supplies like thread, cones and other supplies needed for her knitting.  In future, she’d like to see her business be prosperous and to have employees.

loans.use: to buy knitting supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Augusto

texts.es:
Carlos a sus 20 años de edad tiene claro cual es el futuro que desea para el y su familia. Lleno de ilusiones y razones para salir adelante, este joven se ha propuesto convertirse en microempresario y para ello ha contado con el apoyo de su madre quien le facilitó un espacio de la vivienda para construir una cochera y dedicarse a la cría y venta de porcinos, actividad con la que espera generar recursos que le permitan aportar para el mejoramiento de las condiciones económicas de su familia y comenzar con sus estudios universitarios.
En la actualidad Carlos se encuentra solicitando un crédito para el financiamiento de dos cerdas de cría y cuido, con el objeto de continuar con la producción de cerdos y convertirse en el proveedor número uno de su localidad.
texts.en: Carlos, 20, has a clear picture of what he wants for his family and himself. Full of dreams and reasons to get ahead, he wants have a micro business. His mother supports his goal and has provided space in the house to build a pen where he can raise pigs to sell. He expects this business to generate income that will improve the family's financial situation and pay for his college courses. Carlos is applying for a loan to buy two pigs so that he can continue to raise the animals and become the main supplier in his area.

loans.use: to buy two pigs to raise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 34 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling a variety of lunch items in her community and has been doing this for two years. Maria has requested a loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, coffee, foil, and a chest freezer. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Maria will pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy coffee, foil, Coca Cola, Fanta, Bongo and buns.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 25 years old and married with two school-going children. He has a retail shop that he has been operating for the past three years, and it has been profitable.

This is his first loan term. He plans to use this amount to buy more stock of goods to sell in his business, including bags of rice, sugar and bundles of maize flour. He also plans to buy more stock of soft drinks, juice, cooking oil, cooking fat, detergents and boxes of bar soap.

Samuel hopes to grow his retail business and open a wholesale or a mini-supermarket, and to make more income so as to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks, juice, cooking oil, cooking fat, detergents and boxes of bar soap.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha has a clothes selling business in Emali town and has been in the business for four years now. She is 49 years old and a married mother to three children.

This will be her first loan term and she plans to use the loan amount to purchase more stock of clothes to sell. These include sweaters, trousers, dresses as well as school uniforms for pupils.

She hopes to expand her business and open a boutique,make more income and be able to provide the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is 49 years old and married with five children.

Florinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like sardines, shampoo, soap, soft drinks and school supplies.

Florinda has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from fishing and fish vending.

Florinda aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like sardines, shampoo, soap, soft drinks and school supplies.

loans.name: Julia Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. July vive en Guayaquil, tiene 45 años. Ella empezó a manejar un vehiculo viejo en donde hacia tazi a personas conocidas poco a poco tuvo los sufientes ingresos para poder comprar un nuevo vehiculo. 

Actualmente realiza los recorridos en un taxi con la ayuda de su esposo, por ahora no tiene ninguna dificultad y espera que con el tiempo no lo tenga. Está casada, su esposo es taxista tienen 3 hijos menores de edad una niña tiene discapacidad  especial. 

El prestamo lo quiere utilizar para el pago del impuesto que tiene para utulizar el taxi. El sueño que quiere realizar es comprar otro vehículo y mejorar sus ingresos y así poder ayudar a su esposo con los ingresos en la casa y así darle una mejor vida a sus hijos y en especial a la niña discapacitada.
texts.en:
July lives in Guayaquil, and is 45 years old. She started driving an older vehicle, providing taxi services to people she knew. Little by little she earned enough income to be able to buy a new vehicle.

Now she does her taxi trips with her husband's help. For now, she is not having any problems and hopes not to have any in the future. She is married, her husband is a taxi driver. They have three minor children, including a daughter with special needs. 

She wants to use the loan to pay the taxes she has to pay for operating the taxi. Her dream is to buy another vehicle,improve her income and this way be able to help her husband with the household income. This will enable her to give a better life to her children, and especially to her special needs daughter.

loans.use: To pay the tax for her yellow taxi.

loans.name: Cristobal Fidencio

texts.es:
El  Sr. Cristóbal vive en Guayaquil, tiene 40 años. El empezó desde pequeño a estudiar y trabajar ayudando a su hermano hasta que decidió ponerse su propio taller de sastreria.

Actualmente realiza su negocio solo, no tiene ninguna dificultad hasta ahora y espera que con el tiempo no lo tenga. No está casado, no tiene hijos. El en su negocio hace pantalones, camisas, ternos para hombres y mujeres etc. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar telas e hilos para su negocio. El sueño que quiere es comprar un terreno para poder construir su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Cristóbal, age 40, lives in Guayaquil.  When he was little he started studying and working by helping his brother.  He did this until he decided to set up his own tailor shop.

He currently works alone.  He has not had any problems so far, and he hopes not to have any in the future.  He is not married, and he does not have children.  In his business he makes pants, shirts, and suits for men and women, etc.

He wants to use the loan to buy fabric and thread for his business.  His dream is to buy a piece of land in order to be able to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Mr. Amjad is 44 years old and is a hardworking man. He is a father of  two children. He belongs to a poor family, and he is the only income-earning person in the family. 

Mr. Amjad has been running a steel shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Presently, he wants to buy new iron sheets, iron rods, welding rods, and soldering rods to sell. For this purpose he requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He is feeling very satisfied after getting a loan from BRAC Pakistan as he is hopeful that he will easily purchase the things his business needs, and that this will help him to increase his net income and savings as well.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets, iron rods, welding rods, soldering rods to sell

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony's business of selling assorted goods is doing well.  He is grateful to both KADET and KIVA lenders for the financial support he received which made it possible for him to expand his business. 

He is requesting a second business loan in order to finance his business further.  He plans to purchase stock including watches, radios, sunglasses and albums that he will sell.

loans.use: to purchase watches, radios, sunglasses and albums.

loans.name: Agiagi

texts.en:
Agiagi is 26 years old and single, with one child. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for four years. 

Agiagi needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken leg quarters, boxes of mutton flaps, and sausages. She hopes to use her profits to help with her family's financial needs. 

She became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of meat for her store.

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
This is Cristeta. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of products like biscuits and different sweets. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, and for their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store for additional income.

Cristeta would like to apply for a new loan of 10,000 PHP in order to buy additional quantities and varieties of biscuits and sweets. She will also use the money to buy grocery items. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Cristeta hopes that her child will finish his studies and dreams that her business will continue to be successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for greater quantities and varieties of products like biscuits and different kinds of sweets to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 40 years old and married, with four children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase items to sell, like sugar, bread, soap, shampoo, and canned goods.

Marivic has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from vegetables-vending. Marivic aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store, like sugar, bread, soap, shampoo, and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, a 34-year-old hardworking gentleman, is married to Mary and the father of two school-going children, aged 11 and 7. For the past three years, Moses has been running a mobile phone shop that does repairs and sells accessories, earning him around KES. 20,000 per month.

He learnt about KADET LTD from one of his regular clients who is a registered member. He has been advanced a fourth loan of KES. 100,000 to purchase mobile accessories.

Moses plans to use the anticipated new profits to enlarge his premises as well as pay school fees for his children. He also plans to put up his own residence on his newly acquired piece of land. His dream is to attain financial sustainability.

loans.use: to purchase mobile accessories.

loans.name: Tutonu

texts.en:
Tutonu is 28 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling BBQ in her community and has been doing this for four years. 

Tutonu has requested a loan to buy mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, and tomato sauce. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tutonu will finally expand her business into some nearby villages.

loans.use: to buy chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, tomato sauce, and mutton flaps.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

Nenita has a business that buys and sells vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables and spices to sell at her stall.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married and works hard to support her family.  She has a general store in the Philippines and has been in business for two years now.

Evelyn requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy items to sell including shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, bread and candies.  In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items including shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, bread and candies.

loans.name: Motu

texts.en:
Motu is a 35-year-old married woman with six children. 

Motu has a small plantation and grows kava to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Motu has requested a loan to buy kava plants, plastic bags, a shovel, and a wheelbarrow.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Motu hopes to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, a shovel, a wheelbarrow, and kava plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock his retail shop with a variety of consumable products and to employ an additional staff member.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Doña Blanca, tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo en una colonia que pertenece a San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene una pulpería desde hace 10 años donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como azúcar, pan, arroz, hurros, dulces, verduras, carnes, refrescos, harina, manteca, etc. doña blanca ha solicitado tres prestamos con el actual para mantener activo su negocio. Este préstamo es por 12,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la pulpería para surtir de verduras, carnes y embutidos, con el fin de generar más ganancias. Ella espera seguir trabajando para que su hijo termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Blanca is 50 years old, married and lives with her husband and son in a neighborhood belonging to the city of San Pedro Sula. She has a small corner store where she has sold basic goods for the past ten years, includng sugar, bread, rice, chips, sweets, vegetables, meat, soft drinks, flour, cream and other items.

Blanca has requested three loans with the current one to keep her business active. This loan is for 12,000 Lempiras and will be invested in her store to stock vegetables, red meat and preserved meats so that she can generate greater earnings. She hopes to continue working so that her son will be able to finish his schooling.

loans.use: to buy food including red meat, preserved meats and vegetables to stock her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years old.  She is married and has five children.  She owns a store and sells grocery items to the people in her village.  She has been in business for three years now.  She usually earns about 5,000 PHP each month that she spends on meals and school allowance.  She is now asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP in order to buy sardines, eggs, noodles and soap to sell in her store. 

Marilyn hopes to continue improving her sales so that she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, noodles and soap to sell in her store.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 48 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. 

Leticia operates a business selling school supplies and has been operating for three years. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP through ASKI to purchase more school supplies such as notebooks, ball pens, coloring pens and paper. 

She hopes that through this loan, with her hard work, she could earn more profit for the success of her business, as well as for their living.

loans.use: to purchase more school supplies such as notebooks, ball pens, coloring pens and paper.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
This is Ma. Dolores. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used for the maintenance of her clinic. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a van-for-rent business for additional income.

Ma. Dolores would like to apply for another loan, this time for 50,000 PHP, for the maintenance of her clinic and to buy operative supplies. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Dolores hopes that her business will last for a long time and dreams that her two daughters will finish their studies. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her clinic and to buy operative supplies.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 37 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 18-year-old daughter, in Rustavi district. Several times, Khatuna requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is a small, monthly salary earned by her husband, working as a baker. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Khatuna requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

Since her husband has a rich experience in this field, she decided to start their own bakery. With the received credit, they will buy all the needed equipment to bake Georgian bread. Khatuna thinks that the business will be profitable and they will be able to increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a Georgian bread bakery.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
Фарход является 45 летний мужчиной, его семья состоит  из 6 человек 4 детей, его жена и он сам.   Он занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота.  Его семья поддерживает его  в бизнесе. Младший сын Фархода  вместо пастуха выводит скот на пастбище и  Фарход купил для сына коня , чтобы он мог легко пасти  скот.  Жена домохозяйка и в свободное от хозяйства времени она присматривает за скотом.  Откорм скота является семейным бизнесом. 
  В настоящее время Фарходу необходимо закупить много сена и различного корма, так как  начале весны  его запас корма закончился, поэтому чтобы его скот не истощал он обратился в Арванд за  финансовой поддержкой.  Фарход хочет на полученный кредит купить корм  для скота.
texts.en:
Farhod is a forty-five-year-old man.  His family is made up of six people, including four children, his wife, and himself.  He earns his living raising livestock and his family supports him in the business.  Instead of a herdsman, his youngest son tends the animals in the pasture; Farhod bought him a horse to make it easier.  Farhod's wife is a homemaker who helps out on the farm in her spare time.  Feeding the animals is a family affair.  

Farhod needs to buy a lot of hay and different kinds of feed because spring is here now and his feed stores are depleted, so he has turned to Arvand for financial support.  He plans to use the loan to buy feed for his livestock.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Ipu

texts.en:
Ipu is a 55-year-old woman who is married and has six children.  She has a small business mowing lawns, which is her service to the community.  She has been in business for many years. 

Ipu needs a loan in order to buy equipment necessary for her lawn mowing business.  Although she will use her profits to feed her family and cope with other family expenses, she will mostly use them to revive her business.  

Ipu joined SPBD in 2011 in order to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy petrol, safety boots and safety clothes.

loans.name: Pele

texts.en: Pele, a 30-year-old married mother of one, has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. In business for three years and a member of SPBD since 2010, Pele needs a loan to buy equipment to enhance her enterprise. She will use the profits from her sales to expand in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, and shovels.

loans.name: Lecy

texts.es:
Lecy, de 42 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora es una madre soltera, tiene 04 hijos de 20, 19, 12 y 08 años de edad, vive en su casa propia en donde habita cómodamente con sus  hijos.EL trabajo de Lecy consiste en la venta nocturna de comida ,  pero desde muy temprano sale al mercado en busca de los pollos y verduras mas frescas, para preparar los mejores paltos y ponerlas en venta en la vereda de su hogar , entre los platos que se encuentrana  a la venta estan : salchipollo, salchipapas, pollo frito y otros antojitos mas que salen mucho por la zona en la que vive; tiene un carrito sanguchero el cual es su herramienta de trabajo, lleva realizando este trabajo por un promedio de 4 años.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo de poder realizar las labores de su hogar y no descuidar a sus  hijos quienes aun necesitan mucho de su cuidado, le esta yendo muy bien ya que gana casi el doble de su inversión, le gustaría mas adelante tener una tienda de abarrotes y poder generar mayores ingresos desde su hogar.Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles, comprará mesas, sillas, y algunos insumos e ingredientes tales como plátano, harina, arroz, etc., a su vez agradece el apoyo financiero que se le brinda para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Lecy is 42 years old and is a happy and hard working single mother. She has four children of the ages of 8, 12, 19 and 20. She lives in her own home where she lives comfortably with her children. Lecy's work consists of selling food during the nighttime but she goes out to the market very early to get the freshest chicken and vegetables and prepare the best dishes she can and sell them outside of her home. Among the dishes that are found here are "salchipollo" (a hot dog and chicken dish), "salchipapas" (a hot dog and french fry dish), fried chicken and other snack foods that are common where she lives. She has a hot dog truck which she uses for work. She has had this business for about four years. 

What she likes most about her job is that it gives her time to carry out her household chores and not neglect her children who still need her care. It is going well for her; she now earns almost double her investment. She would like to have a grocery store in the future so that she can generate greater earnings from her home. With the amount requested of 1000 soles, she wil buy tables, chairs and some supplies and ingredients including plantains, flour, rice, etc. She is thankful for the financial support that is brought to her so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and supplies to prepare foods.

loans.name: Jovana

texts.es: Jovana es la propietaria de un café internet que fue financiado por Kiva para comprar impresoras, computadores y una vitrina. Con esta inversión sus ventas se incrementaron y así mismo su clientela, especialmente de estudiantes, pues por la actualización que el servicio es mucho mas rápido. Jovana le envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores: “Doy  gracias a las personas que me apoyaron desinteresadamente a través del crédito, para sacar adelante nuestro  negocio  y que nos sigan apoyando, ya que es una bonita labor. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una nueva computadora y otra vitrina para surtirla de detalles y papelería , lo cual dará respuesta a este nuevo mercado. “
texts.en:
Jovana is the owner of an internet cafe that got a Kiva loan for the purchase of printers, computers, and a display case. With this investment her sales increased, as did her clientele. She has especially seen a growth in student clientele. Her service is now much more rapid. Jovana sends the following message to the lenders: "I thank those who have supported me unselfishly through loans, so that I can get the business ahead. Thank you for continuing to support us, since this is a good work." 
She is currently applying for a Kiva loan which she will use for the purchase of a new computer and another display case which she will stock with small items and stationery. This will be in response to the new market.

loans.use: to buy a new computer and another display case to stock with small items and stationery.

loans.name: Mistubish Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is in her mid-thirties, is married with two sons who are still going to school. She has been running a food-vending business for three years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 a.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Elizabeth's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock missing items in the food store, bought more sodas, juice and water, and bought a blender to make fresh juice. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.

Elizabeth will use this loan to buy more chairs, increase the stock of baking flour, beans, cooking oil, and rice, and to buy more sodas and water. She dreams of owning a big hotel.

Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group "Mistubish." The group of 14 members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chairs, increase the stock of baking flour, beans, cooking oil, and rice and to buy more sodas and water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay rent for the commercial premises.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es: Luz mary de 44 años de edad tiene un hospedaje desde al año 2010 en varias de sus habitaciones estudiantes, trabajadores provenientes de otras zonas del país acuden a ella para solicitar arrenamiento de habitaciones o de los apartamentos que tiene disponible para ello. En la actualidad se acerca una época de mucha demanda de este servicio y requiere prepararse para resolver las necesidades de su clientela. Esta es la razón para acceder a un credikiva, mediante el cual adecuará 3 habitaciones mas con lo cual mejorará sustancialmente su capacidad de ocupación. Pues su meta es lograr que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios universitarios, pues en condiciones de separada trabaja persistentemente para llegar a cumplir su sueño de prosperidad.
texts.en: Luz Mary is 44 years old and has owned a hostel since 2012. She rents her rooms and small apartments to students and workers from other parts of the country. Currently, a season of high demand is approaching and she wants to get ready to be able to serve the necessities of her clients. This is why she needs a loan, which she will use to renovate three rooms, increasing the amount of guests they can accommodate. Her goal is to be able to continue to provide for the university studies of her three children. She is a single mother and works hard to be able to reach her dream of prosperity.

loans.use: to renovate three rooms in her hostel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy phone credit

loans.name: Atalani

texts.en:
Atalani is 52 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling canteen (foods) in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Atalani has requested a loan to buy ingredients needed for making her canteen. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. Atalani will use her earnings to improve her business to get more money.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks and pork buns.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luafulu

texts.en:
Luafulu is a 42-year-old woman who is married with two children. She is currently running a taxi business. She has five years with this business. 

Luafulu needs a loan to buy new wheels, seat covers, brake pads, and a taxi sign. She will use her profits to pay for her children's education. 

Luafulu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, seat covers, a taxi sign, and brake pads.

loans.name: Fatima Julissa

texts.es:
Fátima, tiene una venta de pan y tortillas. Ella vive con su familia, su esposo de 20 años de edad y su hija de 2 meses de nacida.
Ella requiere y solicita un préstamo para ir creciendo en su negocio ya que lleva 2 años de estar realizándolo, lo aprendio de una tia y le gusta lo que hace, le servira para compra de pan dulce y frances, y maiz para las tortillas. Esto le ayudara para aumentado los clientes, incrementar sus ingresos así   tambien ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Fátima sells bread and tortillas.  She lives with her family, her husband, 20, and her two-month-old daughter.

She needs and is requesting a loan to grow in her business because she has had it for two years.  She learned it from an aunt and she likes what she does.  The loan will let her buy sweet bread and French bread, and corn for the tortillas.

This will help her expand her clientele, increase her income, and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread, French bread, and corn

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, de 65 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, esta divorciada del padre de sus 2 hijas de 24 y de 22 años de edad y su nieto. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Antonia es la venta de bebidas gasificadas, para lo cual cuenta con una refrigeradora en su propia casa, en donde puede guardar su producto a la temperatura que le agrada a su público consumidor, quienes compran para llevar a tomar en otros lugares. Lleva dedicandose a esta actividad un promedio de 03 años.Decidió empezar esta actividad económica para solventar los gastos de su hogar por el abandono de su esposo.   Comenta que en ésta actividad no se pierde por ser un producto de bastante consumo.Este es el préstamo número 04 con Kiva, se siente agradecida con el financiamiento recibido, para continuar con su negocio, ,  por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.En esta oportunidad solicitara S/. 1000 soles para la compra de su mercadería, como las bebidas gasificadas en variados sabores y marcas, buscando precios bajos por el volumen de sus compras, de esa manera espera aumentar su margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Antonia, age 65, is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She is divorced from the father of her two daughters, ages 22 and 24. She also has a grandchild. They live together in their own home.
Antonia sells pop. For her business, she has a fridge in her own home where she is able to keep her product at a temperature that her customers appreciate. They buy her pop in order to take it elsewhere to drink. Antonia has had this business for about three years. She decided to start her business in order to cover her household costs after her husband left.
She says that this is a business where you can't lose because there is so much pop consumption. This is her fourth loan with Kiva. She is grateful for the loans as she will be able to continue with her business. She promises to be punctual in repaying her quotas. She is now requesting 1000 soles for the purchase of merchandise. She will buy pop of various flavours and brands, looking for low prices and volume discounts. She hopes to increase her profit margin this way.

loans.use: to buy pop.

loans.name: Yolanda Olimpia

texts.es:
Yolanda,  se le presenta la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo préstamo, para invertir más en la venta de ropa, así podrá comprar variedad en blusas, vestidos, trajes para damas y niños. 
El adquirir créditos para Yolanda le es de suma importancia porque con ello ha podido mejorar sus condiciones económicas dentro de su familia y en el negocio porque han ido aumentando sus ingresos.
texts.en: Yolanda needs a new loan to purchase more clothing. This will help her purchase a variety of blouses, dresses and outfits for women and children. These loans are critical for Yolanda because, with them, she has been able to improve the financial situation of her family and her business because they have helped to increase her income.

loans.use: purchase women's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en: Lupe is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Lupe has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, deep pots, yeast and cooking oil. She joined SPBD to gain access to funds. With her earnings, Lupe will pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, yeast, and cooking oil

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco de 46 años, originario de Granada, casado, padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 18 y 24 años, actualmente solo 1 estudia y el otro trabaja,  de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la construcción de casa. Inicio trabajando con otras personas ya que el necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y poder mantener  a su familia, fue asi que  decidió viajar a los Estados Unidos a trabajar en remodelación de casa, fue allí que adquirió experiencia y total dominio del trabajo,  luego decidió emprender su propio negocio en la misma zona en donde habita,  para obtener mejores ingresos, poco a poco ha podido comprar sus propias herramientas necesarias para construir casas,  se siente muy  orgulloso porque este negocio le genera ingresos ,cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.
Francisco esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar maquinas, palas, taladro, lijas,  soldador, etc. pues necesita comprar mas herramientas de trabajo para tener en mayor cantidad, para no atrasarse cuando tenga que construir más casas, tiene como planes comprar un carro para poder movilizarse mas rápido a su lugar de trabajo.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 46, is from Granada. He is married with two children ages 18 and 24. One of his children works and the other studies. He is a merchant and works in home construction. He started working with other people because he needed a way to make a living and support his family. This is how he decided to travel to the United States to work in home remodeling. There, he gained experience and completely mastered the work. He later decided to open his own business in his neighbourhood in order to make a better income. Bit by bit he has been able to buy his own tools for building houses. He is very proud because this business generates an income for him. He counts on his wife's support.
Francisco is requesting a loan for the purchase of machines, shovels, a drill, sandpaper, a welder, etc. He needs to buy more work tools so that he will have more. This way he won't be late when he has to build more houses. He plans to buy a car so that he can get to his work sites more quickly.

loans.use: to buy machines, shovels, a drill, sandpaper, and a welder.

loans.name: Delmy Esperanza

texts.es:
Delmy, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, lo cual le ayudara a pagar el arrendamiento de tierras para  cultivar  los granos básicos.
El préstamo anterior, le ayudo para la compra de herbicidas y abono para sus cultivos, tambien con estas ganancias ha podido ofrecer más ayuda a su familia, apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y en la alimentación al igual en la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en: Delmy is requesting a new loan because she needs more working capital to grow corn and beans. This loan will help her pay the rent for her land to grow these staples. Her previous loan helped her buy herbicides and fertilizer for her crops. With the income she has been able to help her family more by supporting her children's studies and feeding her family as well as making improvements to her home.

loans.use: pay rent on the land she farms.

loans.name: Javaid

texts.en:
Mr. Javaid is a supplier of used plastic, iron rods, etc. He has been doing this for many years. He purchases these materials at a low price and sells them at a high rate. He is a very hard-working person, and he lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  He is a 43-year-old married man. 

Mr. Javaid has requested a loan for 100,000 PKR from BRAC Pakistan to purchase scrap iron, steel, silver, and plastic to sell. He wants to increase his business and put aside some savings for the future of his family. He is feeling very satisfied after getting this loan.

loans.use: To purchase scrap iron, steel, silver, and plastic to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She raises hogs as a source of income and she wants to improve her sales through providing the vital needs of her hogs. 

For this reason, Corazon is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy vitamins, feed and medicine. It will be a great help to her hogs and her family’s living economy.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feed and medicine.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 38 years old and married with 2 children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosalie has a general store in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like soap, sugar, coffee, spices, eggs, etc.

Rosalie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store like soap, sugar, coffee, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Taualofa

texts.en:
Taualofa is a 34-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation that grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Taualofa has requested a loan to buy equipment and everything she needs for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

With her profits, Taualofa hopes to extend her business and save more money for the better future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, and a grass cutter.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 53 años de edad,  está casada con  Marden quien es el padre de sus 4 hijos: los 3 mayores ya son independientes razón por la cual vive en compañia de su última hija y su esposo en la casa de material noble que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo.La  actividad que realiza Isabel es la venta de helados de una marca reconocida y bebidas gasificadas de diversos sabores y marcas, ya que cuenta con un refrigerador instalado  en su hogar el cual logró comprar con sus propios ingresos, comenta que en temporada de verano tiene bastante demanda, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes.Le gusta su actividad ya que obtiene buenos ingresos económicos con los cuales logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, para brindar  educación a su hija menor, como lo hizo con sus  hijos mayores.Con su actividad económica se siente una persona productiva y desea continuar con su actividad, buscando hacerlo crecer y tener mayores ganancias.Este es el préstamo número 04 con Kiva, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, por eso se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con el plago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de 1600 nuevos soles comprará más productos para su negocio como los helados de marca y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Isabel, 53, is married to Marden, the father of her four children.  The three oldest are already independent, which is why she lives with her husband and her last daughter in a house of solid materials that they built with a lot of effort.

Isabel's job is selling a well-known brand of ice cream and various flavors and brands of carbonated beverages.  She has a refrigerator installed in her home that she bought with her own income.  She says she has a lot of demand in the summer, when she serves her customers pleasantly.

She likes her work because she gets good income with which she's able to pay for the household expenses and give her youngest daughter an education, just as she did with her older children.  Her job makes her feel like a productive person.  She wants to continue with her work, trying to make it grow and have more profits.

This is her fourth loan with Kiva.  She's happy about the financial support she has been receiving, so she pledges to continue making her payments punctually.

With the requested amount of 1600 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll buy more products for her business, such as brand ice cream and soda.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and ice cream

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: repair the table she uses to display her meats.

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en:
Ghaleb is a married Iraqi client, who is 43 years old and has three children. Ghaleb works hard enough in his grocery store to provide his family income. He provides his neighborhood with supplies like soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2009 and gained good experience in it. Ghaleb is well known in the surrounding and has an excellent reputation.
Ghaleb is requesting a $1,800 loan to buy a motor generator for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children a good education, and one day, buy a bigger house and a bigger grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator for his shop

loans.name: Jasem

texts.en:
Jasem is 24 years old. He is an Iraqi youth client, who is married and has two children. He is the sole provider of the family.

Jasem owns a big motor generator, type KVA 450, and provides his neighbourhood with electricity. He has been in this business since 2011. Throughout his career, Jasem grew fast. He now has an employee and has gained a good reputation in his area.

Jasem is requesting a $2,400 youth loan. This loan will help him buy and install a piece of equipment on his motor generator, which will increase the volume of electrical energy that his motor generator can provide. In the future, he is aiming to buy a new Eco-friendly motor generator, which is silent and doesn't disturb his surroundings.

loans.use: to buy and install a piece of equipment on his motor generator

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis, de 53 años de edad, esta casada con Aurelio quien es obrero de construcción civil, y fruto de esa unión tiene 03 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Gladis es la confección y venta de ropas interiores de damas y caballeros, para lo cual cuenta con una maquina que compró con sus ahorros , se inicio hace más de 21 años en la costura, confeccionando primero para sus familiares y vecinos, ahora ha logrado hacer crecer sus clientes gracias a sus buenos trabajos, contando con la ayuda de su hermana quien también está aprendiendo éste oficio de costura.En el pasado tenía dificultades económicas en su hogar ya que no contaba con un empleo estable, por ello puso un negocio para generar ingresos económicos y asi apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Desea continuar trabajando y ampliar su negocio confeccionando faldas y blusas para surtir su negocio.Este es el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP, por tanto cuenta con su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, comprará materiales para costura como telas, blondas elásticas y otros, los cuales los traerá desde la capital buscando precios más bajos para sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Gladis, 53 years old, is married to Aurelio, who is a construction worker. They have 3 children from this marriage, who live with them in their own house.

Gladis makes and sells underclothes for women and men, using a sewing machine that she bought with her savings. She started sewing more than 21 years ago. She started off sewing for family and neighbors, and now has managed to grow her customer base thanks to her good work. Her sister, who is also learning how to sew, helps her. 

In the past, she had economic difficulties at home because she didn't have stable employment, and for this reason she started her own business to generate income and support her spouse with household expenses. She wishes to continue working and expand her business, making skirts and shirts to stock her business. 

This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she counts on their collaboration to continue working toward her goals. With the amount she is requesting, 3000 nuevos soles, she will buy material for sewing, like fabric and elastic lace, among others. She will buy these in the capital, seeking lower prices for her bulk purchases.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing, like fabric and needles.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson has a retail shop in Tala town and it has been profitable for the past nine years that he has been in the business. He is 31 years old, married and has a six year old child.

This will be his third loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of sugar, wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil to sell. He anticipates to make more income with which he will use to purchase more stock of goods.

Johnson hopes to open a wholesale shop, make more income, and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en: Tomasa is 48 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Tomasa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to purchase more stock to sell in her store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, diapers and school supplies. In the future Tomasa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Buenerge

texts.es:
Buenerge, solicita un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita invertir más capital de trabajo en el cultivo de maíz y frijol. Esto le ayudara para el pago del arrendamiento de tierras para el cultivo de los granos básicos.
El crédito anterior le permitió comprar insumos agrícolas para el cultivo y aportar en su familia, crecer académicamente a sus hijos y con la alimentación.
texts.en:
Buenerge is asking for a new loan because he needs to invest more working capital into growing corn and beans. This will help him to pay to lease land to grow bulk grains.

His last loan permitted him to buy agricultural inputs for farming, to support his family, to help his children grow academically and to buy food.

loans.use: to pay to lease land.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh, 32 years old, is widowed and has two daughters. She supports her family through the income she earns from selling fruit. She began this business ten years ago. She lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hanh intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy a greater quantity and variety of fruit to sell. This will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and her profit will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of fruit to sell

loans.name: Jeany Ann

texts.en:
Jeany Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, bread, soft drinks, etc. for her general store business.

Jeany Ann has been in this business for 16 years. She earns more income from pig fattening and farming sugarcane.

Jeany Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, bread, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Foloi

texts.en: Foloi is a 50-year-old married woman with two children.She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Foloi has requested a loan to buy equipment and taro plants to extend her business .She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Foloi hopes to expand her business and to save some money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, shovels, gloves, taro plants and bush knives.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is a 62-year-old woman who is married with three children. She is currently running a taxi business. She has three years with this business. Selina needs a loan to buy new tyres, seat covers, brake pads, and a taxi sign. She will use her profits to pay for her grandchildren's education. Selina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy seat covers, brake pads, a taxi sign, and new tyres.

loans.name: Suliveta

texts.en: Suliveta is a 35 year old married woman with 4 children. She catches and sells fish in her community to earn a living. She and her husband have being doing this for many years. Suliveta needs a loan to buy fishing gear such as spears, goggles, nets and a canoe. She plans to use her profits to improve the business. Suliveta has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear such as spears, goggles, nets and a canoe

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia is 53 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.
