Celia has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the business for 6 years and earns some additional income from pig fattening. Celia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 53 years old. She is married with five children.

Carmencita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 19,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Carmencita has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for nine years and also earns an income from farming vegetables and raising livestock businesses.

Carmencita aspires to save money to buy a delivery truck for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is a 32-year-old married woman with two children. She would like to start growing taro and banana to earn a living. Mele has requested a loan to buy equipment and other items she will need such as fertilizer, gloves, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and shovels for her business. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) for 2 years. Mele will spend her profits to pay her children's school fees and save some for a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, gloves, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and shovels.

loans.name: Mary Vi

texts.en:
Mary Vi is 36 years old and married with two children.

Mary Vi works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Mary Vi has borrowed and paid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mary Vi aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Fay

texts.en: Fay is a 41 year old woman who is married with 3 children. She has a small taxi business, which she has been running for 2 years. Fay needs a loan to buy a new water tank and a water pump for her taxi. She will use her profits to help with her family’s weekly expenses. Fay joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new water tank and a water pump for her taxi

loans.name: Salote

texts.en: Salote is 62 years old and married with 3 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 7 years. Salote has requested a loan to buy fabric, fabric paint, brushes and wooden carved designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric, fabric paint, brushes and wooden carved designs

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa is 42 years old and married. She has been running an internet shop in front of her home for five years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and to help raise her three children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Thoa is requesting a loan to pay for upgrading and maintaining the computer system of her shop.

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to have more money to reinvest in her business and also have some to set aside for dealing with any future difficulties.

loans.use: to pay for upgrading and maintaining the computer system of her shop.

loans.name: Maradi

texts.en:
Maradi is 64 years old and is from Telavi district, East Georgia. She lives with her pensioner husband, son and daughter-in-law. Maradi had requested for a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for her family is the small incomes of her husband and son. Both are working as artisans: they repair cars and receive a small daily income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Maradi requested loan from Credo for a start-up family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and who are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Maradi will purchase all the needed equipment for the grocery store that she plans to open, in which she will work as a sales lady. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Lagafuaina

texts.en: Lagafuaina is 38 years old, married, and has six children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community, as she has been doing for many years. Lagafuaina has requested a loan to buy fishing gear as needed. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lagafuaina will improve her business and make sure she can receive more income from it.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear, a spear, a canoe and goggles for her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 39 years old. She is married and has four children. She sells animals, such as goats, and has been in this business for seven years. With this loan, she wants to buy more goats for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more goats for sale.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, 41, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income by providing a photocopy service. They started this business 13 years ago. 

Thao is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of paper and materials and upgrading her copying / printing machines to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of paper and materials, and to upgrade her printing/copying machines

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as beverages to restock her store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a range of new products, such as beverages

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice, a retail shop owner, used his previous loan amount to purchase more stock of goods to sell. These included crates of bread, a 90-kilogram sack of sugar and salt among other items  and it has been profitable.

This being his second loan from KADET LTD, he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of soft drinks and bales of maize flour for sale and pay school fees for his child. He also anticipates using the income generated from his business to invest back into his business.

In future, Maurice hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks and bales of maize flour for sale and  pay school fees for his child

loans.name: Danita

texts.en:
This is Danita, who previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her additional earnings were a big help in her children’s education and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Danita is requesting a new loan for 27,000 PHP to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available, the better profit she will enjoy. Those profits will definitely help her to sustain her children’s educational and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Danita dreams of giving her children a good life and future, and hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food supplies and soft drinks.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men is a 53-year-old married woman. She lives with four daughters, one son and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money working as a driver. For eight years, Men has been selling clothing. She would like a loan to purchase better quality products of clothes at competitive prices from wholesalers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality products of clothes at competitive prices from wholesalers.

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
This is Florife. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store, thus generating more income. She also has a direct selling business for additional income. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their everyday needs. She would like to apply for another loan, of 40,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Florife dreams that her business will continue to grow and that she will have other branches. She hopes to give her children a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, allowing her to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en: Condrada is married and works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising livestock. Condrada is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase a larger stock of charcoal to sell. Condrada has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase a larger stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ana Faith

texts.en: Ana Faith works hard to support her family. She is single parent with a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Ana Faith is borrowing PHP 4,600 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her expenses for kerosene. Ana Faith is aware that, by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and accident risks for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp and cut her kerosene costs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 51 years old and has three children. She is married and has a small hog business as a source of income. She has been doing it for over 10 years now. She hopes to improve the growth of her hogs; that is why she is asking for additional capital to sustain her hogs. She is asking for P6,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs. 

Marilyn hopes to keep raising healthy hogs to sell them at a higher price someday. Additional revenue will be used for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hogs' sustainability

loans.name: Nika

texts.en:
Nika is a 42-year-old married woman with five children. She would like to start growing bananas and taro to earn a living. Nika has requested a loan to buy tools to expand her plantation. She has been a member of SPBD for 2 years. 

Nika will spend her profits to pay her children's school fees and extend her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, gloves, and shovels.

loans.name: Munai

texts.en:
Munai is 28 years old and married with two children. She makes and sells elei (made by traditional fabric printing) and designs materials to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Munai has requested a loan to buy materials needed for making her products for her business. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, threads, fabric and material.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: Chantal est une femme Camerounaise âgé de 40 ans. marié et mère de  06 enfants dont 03 vont à l'école, Chantal est spécialisée dans la vente des beignets depuis près de 11 ans dans un quartier de la place. le quartier  grandissant de même que la population, Chantal souhaite avec le crédit acheter la matière première afin d'augmenter et améliorer la qualité de beignets. les bénéfices obtenus seront réinjecter dans l'activité et permettront également à Chantal d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Chantal is a 40-year old woman from Cameroon, married, with six children, three of whom are in school. She has been selling fritters for over 11 years in a local neighborhood. Since her neighborhood is expanding and its population growing, Chantal would like to buy the ingredients to expand the quantity and enhance the quality of her fritters. The revenues will be reinvested in Chantal’s business and will also allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is still working as a mechanic repairing motorcyles. After getting financial assistance from KADET and the KIVA lenders, he has been able to boost his monthly income to KES 36,000, which he uses to support his family. 

John is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He is glad for the financial support he has been receiving from KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan to purchase motorcyle spare parts.
His hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle .

loans.name: Zubeda Kadara

texts.en:
Zubeda Kadara is a 45 yr. old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 6 children between the ages of 5 and 20. All of them go to school. Zubeda Kadara runs a general store and has been in business for 7 years. She has no employees. 

She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 3,000 SSP to purchase potatoes, and many others. She has no other source of income. In 5 years she would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Zubeda Kadara says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Аселе 34 лет. Аселя в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 11 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Асель в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 10 овец,3 коз и 3 лошади, продажа молока и перепродажа скота приносит около 10,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асела обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Аселя будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Asel is 34 years old. As a main source of income for her business, Asel has been raising livestock and growing produce for 11 years, having launched this business with a starting capital of 10,000 KGS. Thanks to Asel’s hard work, her farm today includes four cows, 10 sheep, three goats and three horses; sales of milk and fattened animals brings in about 10,000 KGS per month. In order to develop her business further, Asel has applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 65,000 KGS to increase her livestock. Asel will invest the resulting revenues in a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a grocer. He is an Iraqi youth client, aged 29 years old, and has a single child.

In his grocery store, Ali offers various types of products for his customers such as canned food, detergents, dairy products and snacks. He established his business in 2009 and has gained good experience in this field. Ali has gained a good reputation in his neighborhood thanks to the competitive selling prices that he offers.

He is requesting a sum of $3,000 as a youth loan to renovate his shop by installing a rolling shutter, an external ceiling, and signage and also to buy a new refrigerator. Ali is an ambitious person. He hopes that this renovation will attract more customers and will result in the increase of his profits.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing a rolling shutter, an external ceiling, and signage and also to buy a new refrigerator

loans.name: Aisa

texts.en: Aisa is 24 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for one year now. Aisa has requested a loan to buy ingredients needed for her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Aisa will expand her business to get a good income.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, large cooking pot, and sugar for her pancake business.

loans.name: Erin

texts.en:
Erin is 24 years old and married with two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, sugar and everything else she needs for her business. 

In the future, Erin hopes to build her own store in front of her house. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, a frying pan, and sugar.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, aged 56 years, runs a small eatery as a source of income. She is generating an income of 150-200 PHP a day that is usually used for her family's daily consumption. She aspires to higher sales in order to sustain additional necessities of their daily living. 

In accordance with this goal, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase eggs, vegetables, rice and fish to cook. Soon, she hopes to keep growing as business owner in order to achieve a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, vegetables, rice and fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers and other necessary products.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a woman of 66 years. She is a widow and a mother of one child.

She sells fresh flowers and has been in this business for eight years, Jane gets a monthly income of 50,000 shillings.

This will be Jane’s second loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more flowers for sale. In future she wants to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy flowers for sale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 49-year-old widow from Homabay town, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She supports six children, ages 12 to 24 years old.

Joyce has a cereals stall in Homabay town. She has been doing this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 16,000. She is applying for her second loan after having paid the previous loan successfully. She will use this loan to purchase more stock of maize, beans and green grams. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

She has a dream of growing her business, educating her children up to university level and having a good life as a family.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans and millet for sale

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is a woman of forty six years. She is divorced and a mother of three children. She is a hair dresser in Nairobi who has been in this business for 16 years and now gets a monthly income of 20,000 KES.  

She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan to buy beauty products like hair oil, massaging cremes etc. for her salon. In the future she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for the salon and do minor repairs

loans.name: Izhar-Ul-Haq

texts.en:
Mr. Izhar-ul-haq has requested for a loan amount of PKR 100,000 from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Since 2004 he has been running a furniture shop in  Lahore, Pakistan. It is the only source of income for the family. He is the father of four children; all of whom are students.

With the loan amount Mr. Izhar-ul-haq will purchase wood, nails, glue and other materials for making furniture to sell. With the profits he makes he wants to expand his business.

He is feeling very happy and satisfied after getting the loan as he is sure that this will help him to increase his net income. He is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, glue and other materials for making furniture to sell.

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en: Matauaina is a 19-year-old married woman with one child. She would like to start growing taro and banana to earn a living. Matauaina has quested a loan to buy items she will need for her business such as fertilizers, a wheelbarrow, shovels and bush knives. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) for 2 years. Matauaina will spend her profits to extend her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, a wheelbarrow, shovels and bush knives.

loans.name: Cai

texts.en:
Cai was born in 1954. She has four children who are adults. Her husband is a farmer and earns about 2,000,000 VND per month. Cai is a noodle seller. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 20 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to raise some chickens and pigs to earn more money for her family. She also wants to use the money to build a pig barn.

loans.use: to raise some chickens and pigs to earn more money for her family.

loans.name: Aluda

texts.en:
Aluda is 40 years old and lives in the small village of Tskaltubo. He is married and lives with his wife and his mother, who receives a retirement pension. 

Aluda is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has two milk cows. His wife milks the cows and produces cheese products to sell at local markets at a good price. 

Besides this, Aluda has a tractor, which is used for the tilling of agricultural land. He serves local people with his tractor and earns some income. Aluda requested a loan to fix his tractor, which is not working. 

After the tractor is fixed, he will be able to continue working and increase the family's income. With the increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Aluda awaits your support.

loans.use: to fix a tractor and continue working.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is 26-year-old Iraqi youth client, who is single and lives with his parents. Abbas assists his parents in providing their monthly income.

Abbas has worked in his small garage since 2010, and offers various services to his clients like vehicle repairs, oil changes, and selling car paints. He has gained good experience in this field and a good reputation in his surroundings thanks to his loyalty and good client service.

Abbas is requesting a youth loan in the amount of $3,000. He will use this loan to install a rolling shutter, an external ceiling and signage for his garage. In the future, he aims to grow his business more and more, and increase his revenues so that he will be able to take care of his parents and provide for their needs.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter, an external ceiling and signage for his garage

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is 56 years old and is married. She has five children and lives with them, and her husband, in Ho Chi Minh City.

She has been running a general store at her house for 16 years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery and confectionery among other items and she intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and that it will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of products to sell, such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines.

Eden requested a loan of PHP 4,600 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Eden is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 54 years old and married with four children.

Gloria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs and renovate her pig cage. She also earns an income from her restaurant and variety store businesses.

Gloria has been raising pigs for eleven years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money for building and expanding business.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and renovate her pig cage.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has completed the construction of the first block of her rental houses and they have all been occupied. This has also assisted her in paying her previous loan.

Beatrice has acquired another loan of KES 100,000 which will enable her to complete the building of a gate and a perimeter wall around the housing block. She hopes to use the additional proceeds to educate her children.

Her hope and dream is to buy other plots and put up more housing units in the view of enhancing good housing for her community.

loans.use: To finish construction of a gate and a perimeter wall

loans.name: Gloria Azucena

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos; de 19, 16 y 13 años de edad respectivamente. Desde hace seis años quedo soltera debido a que su esposo viajo a los estados unidos y desde entonces no supo nada de él. Desde entonces, ella ha tenido que trabajar sola para mantener a sus hijos hoy en día solo tiene dos a su cargo; ya que la mayor ya se caso. Gloria, se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos y a vender productos de una empresa por catalogo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ladrillo, arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra; para construir las paredes para su cocina. Debido a que en este momento esta totalmente desprotegido y en el invierno se le moja, además que ingresan animales y no puede dejar los alimentos con mucha confianza porque se los comen. Su sueño, es que sus hijas estudien por lo  menos hasta bachillerato y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gloria is 36 years old and is the single mother to three children who are 19, 16 and 13 years old respectively. She has been single for six years, because her spouse travelled to the United States and since then she hasn't heard anything from him. Since then, she has had to work alone to support her children. Nowadays only two are dependents, since the oldest has already gotten married. Gloria works performing household chores and selling the products of a business by catalogue.

She is asking for this loan from Fundación Campo to buy bricks, sand and cement, and to pay for labour, so that she can build walls for her kitchen. At the moment it is completely unprotected and in the winter it gets wet. On top of that, animals can get in and she can't leave food in there with much confidence because it will get eaten. Her dream is for her daughters to stay in school at least until high school, and to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labour to build walls for her kitchen.

loans.name: Leitulua

texts.en: Leitulua is a 43-year-old woman who is married with six children. She runs a sewing business in her community. She has being doing this for many years and has experience in the business. Leitulua has requested a loan to buy materials and a new sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to improve and expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, fabric and thread

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz es una joven mujer de 30 años de edad con mucha fuerza, mucha energía, madre sotera emprendedora con muchos deseos de salir adelante. Ella tiene tres hijos menores que dependen de ella en todos los aspectos y están estudiando en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completa la cual agradece el esfuerzo impuesto de sus padres para que ella tuviese un conocimiento básico y que no pudo completar debido a la falta de recursos económicos. Gracias a sus padres ella aprendió a cultivar y sembrar café desde muy joven actividad que hasta hoy en día elabora para llevar alimentación a su hogar y generar ingresos para su familia. La propiedad que ella tiene es propia misma que fue heredada por sus padres para que ella pudiese generar ingresos la cual esta ubicada a cuatro kilómetros de su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada a pie diariamente.      

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono y pago de mano de obra para poder limpiar y fortalecer sus cultivos de café ya que ella es madre soltera y no tiene apoyo de nadie para elaborar esta actividad la cual requiere de mucho tiempo y mucho trabajo.
  
Su sueño es lograr que sus tres hijos menores se preparen para que alcancen un mejor nivel de educación y de esa forma mejorar su nivel de vida económico que al mismo tiempo sean personas emprendedoras con metas y con sueños para que lo que se propongan lo hagan realidad.
texts.en:
Mariluz, 30, is a young woman with a lot of strength and energy.  She an enterprising single mother with a great desire to get ahead.  She has three minor children who depend on her in every way.  They're in different grades in elementary school.  

She finished elementary school.  She's thankful for her parents' effort for her to have a basic knowledge, which she wasn't able to complete because of a lack of financial resources.
 
Thanks to her parents she learned how to grow coffee from a young age, a job she has done up to the present so she can feed her family and generate income for them.  Her property is her own.  Her parents gave it to her so she could generate income.  It's located four kilometers from her house and she walks there every day.

Currently she's asking for help to buy fertilizer and manure, and to pay for labor to help weed and strengthen her coffee crops.  She's a single mother and doesn't have any help to to this job that requires a lot of time and work.

Her dream is for her three minor children to be prepared to achieve a higher level of education so they can improve their standard of living, and for them to be enterprising people with goals and dreams that will come true.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 21 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for one year. Ana has requested a loan to buy ingredients needed for running her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ana will  improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil and a large cooking pot.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denys con su anterior crédito compró productos mediante su guía especializada o catálogos, sus clientes se sintieron bien atendidos y ella pudo aumentar su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará perfumería, cremas, cosméticos y productos capilares, que han sido encargados por su clientela e igualmente necesita responderles para continuar fidelizándolos. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores: “ Agradezco la ayuda recibida y los invito a seguir apoyando a los microempresarios de Colombia. “
texts.en: Denys, with her previous loan, purchased products through specialized magazines and catalogs. Her clients feel she has provided a good service and she has the potential to increase her working capital. Today, she is applying for a new loan with Kiva that she will use to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and hair products that have been ordered by her clients; she needs to meet demand in order to keep them happy. She sends the following message to her Kiva lenders: "I am thankful for the help I have received and I invite them to continue funding micro-businesses in Colombia."

loans.use: purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and hair products.

loans.name: Calixtro Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Calixtro Pedro esta casado, tiene 42 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 1 de ellos están estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía, especificamente al tejido de cortes típicos,inicio este trabajo por su propia iniciativa y hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales: hilos de diferentes clases y colores, para poder elaborar los cortes tipicos. espera en un futuro ver su negocio prospero para la mejora de su familia.
texts.en:
Calixtro Pedro is married, 42 years old, and studied for the six years of primary school. He has three children, one of whom is in school. He makes a living producing traditional crafts and weaving traditional patterns. He began this work due to his own initiative and has seven years of experience. 

He is requesting a loan to buy materials such as different kinds and colors of thread. In the near future he hopes his business will prosper so he can improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy thread to make traditional crafts.

loans.name: Davide

texts.en:
Davide is 35 years old. He is married, with two children, aged two and four years. Neither of his children go to school, they are still young. 

With the loan, Davide wants to buy more cassava, bananas, and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, bananas, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Yesenia Xiomara

texts.es:
Yesenia, solicita un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer el negocio de piñatas y poder hacer una carrosa de la fiesta de la Ciudad donde necesita comprar papelería, alambre, colores, pintura y madera.
Con el préstamo anterior ella obtuvo mejores ganancias, lo cual ya tiene un local propio ya que antes era en su casa. Se siente satisfecha poder trabajar con créditos porque le ayudan a mejor su situación familiar y su negocio.
texts.en: Yesenia is applying for a new loan to grow her piñata business and to be able to make a festival float for the city and so she needs to purchase stationery, wires, colored pencils, paint and wood. With the previous loan, she was able to earn a profit that she used to get her own store because previously she was working out of her home. She is satisfied with working with the loans because they help her to improve her family's life as well as her business.

loans.use: purchase stationery, wires, colored pencils,  paint and wood.

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en:
Rafiqa is a 52-year-old woman. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of products, such as office supplies, some candies, toys, and candles. She has eight years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and the demand of clients. 

The products she sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is AZN 150. 

Her husband is sick and can need care, that’s why her brother helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole income in her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location, in the central bazaar of her home city.

Rafiqa applied for an AZN 2,000 loan to purchase more merchandise and to diversify the range of goods to cover her customers' demands. She has a long loan history with Aqroinvest Credit Union and has proven herself to be a trusted and good client.

loans.use: to buy more products and diversify her merchandise.

loans.name: Safae

texts.en:
Safae is 23 years old. He is a youth client from Iraq who lives with his parents. Safae helps his parents in providing the family income.

Safae owns a barber shop. After working for several years as an employee at a barber shop, Safae gained enough experience to establish his own business, which he did in 2012. His dynamism and creativity spread a good reputation about him.

Safae is requesting a youth loan in the amount of $2,500. This loan will be used to renovate his barber shop by painting the walls and installing new mirrors, as well as to install an external ceiling. Through this loan, Safae is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to improve his and his parent’s current financial situations.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop

loans.name: Lei

texts.en: Lei is a 23-year-old married woman with no children. She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. Lei has requested a loan to buy everything she needs to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Lei will spend her profits to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, a wheel barrow, bush knives, shovels, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 53 years old and sells snacks such as barbecue, fish ball, and kikiam in her village. To offer more goods, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy sugar, salt, vinegar, fish ball and pork to make barbecue. Veronica is looking forward to the betterment of their lifestyle through her loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, vinegar, fish ball and pork to make barbecue

loans.name: Cruz Del Norte Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Marina, tiene 33 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Ella es socia del grupo "Cruz del Norte" grupo formado por seis socios, éste grupo ha recibido su segundo desembolso, han demostrado ser un grupo responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
La Sra. Marina se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de papa rellena por las noches, éste es su actividad principal de forma independiente, por las mañanas para mejorar su economía trabaja como ayudante de cocina.
Uno de sus sueños de la Sra. Marina, es tener un restaurante, con ésto ella podría mejorar su economía y ya no necesitaría trabajar como ayudante de cocina.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de descartables e insumos para la venta de papa rellena.
texts.en:
Marina, age 33, has two children.  She is a member of the “Cruz del Norte" group, which is comprised of six members.  This group has received its second disbursement.  They have demonstrated that they are a responsible group and punctual with their payments.

Marina has been selling stuffed potatoes in the evenings for over five years.  This is her primary independent business activity.  In the mornings she works as a kitchen helper in order to improve her finances.

One of Marina’s dreams is to have a restaurant.  This way she would be able to improve her finances, and she would no longer need to work as a kitchen helper.

She will use the loan she received to buy disposable items and supplies in order to sell stuffed potatoes.

loans.use: to buy disposable items and supplies in order to sell stuffed potatoes.

loans.name: Nery Adalberto

texts.es:
Nery tiene 36 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive con su familia en una aldea de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Nery se dedica a la agricultura, lleva cultivando café hace 5 años.  Este negocio ha sido su fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia, el café lo vende en el mercado local a buen precio, trabaja todo el día en los cultivos.
El esta solicitando su cuarto préstamo de 28,000 lempiras para invertirlo en comprar fertilizante y darle mantenimiento general a su finca, piensa que con esta inversión tendrá una mejor producción de cosecha y sus cosechas serán mejores.
Su meta es seguir mejorando los cultivos dando el mantenimiento adecuado.
texts.en:
Nery, 36, is married and has a son.  He lives with his family in a village in Taulabe, Comayagua.  He has been working in agriculture for five years.  This business has been his source of income to support his family.  He sells the coffee in the local market at a good price.  He works at his crops every day.

He’s asking for his fourth loan for 28,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizer and provide general crop care.  He believes that with this investment his crop yields will be larger and his harvests will be better.  His goal is to continue improving his crops providing them with adequate maintenance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to provide crop care.

loans.name: Esperanza Esther

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 33 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Esperanza se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos semillas y fungicidas para cuidar los cultivos

El sueño es tener dinero para ponerse otro negocio para tener otra fuente de ingresos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta caminar y hacer un poco de ejercicio.
texts.en:
Esperanza, 33, lives in a common-law marriage and has one child.  She lives with her husband and child in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She's a member of San Juan Communal Bank, located in the San Francisco area of San Juan Parish.  The members are farmers.

Esperanza makes a living growing cacao.  She's requesting the loan to buy supplies, fertilizer, manure, seed, and fungicide to take care of her crops.

Her dream is to have money to set up another business to have another source of income.

In her free time she likes to walk and exercise a little.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizer, manure, seed, and fungicide

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a 44-year-old married Iraqi client and a father of five children. He owns a small shop where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2007, and has been working hard to provide his children’s school fees. The quality and variety of his products attract more and more customers, earning him a good reputation in his area.

Mouhammad is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use the loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. By paying his rent, he hopes to increase his profits in the upcoming days so he will satisfy his family’s needs.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
María, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque se encuentra descapitalizada. Con ello le ayudara mucho para comprar  bebidas, refrescos, golosinas, carnes, maíz, leña, gas propano.  
Ha ella le fue de mucha satisfacción el préstamo anterior, porque genero ingresos para solventar sus deudas, gastos del hogar y personales. Ha mejorado de una forma notoria económicamente y agradece la ayuda que se le da con los créditos oportunos.
texts.en:
Once again María is seeking a loan because she needs working capital. She plans to use it to buy drinks, candy, meat, corn, firewood, and propane gas.

She has been very pleased with the previous loan because it generated sufficient income so she could pay off her debts and pay for household and personal expenses. Her finances have improved greatly, and she is grateful for the help that these timely loans have provided.

loans.use: buy drinks, candy, meat, corn, firewood, and propane gas

loans.name: Omar De Jesus

texts.es:
Omar, solicita un nuevo crédito por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio y así aumentar sus ingresos. Esto le ayudara para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, insecticidas, pesticidas y otros más para sus cultivos.
Ha Omar le ha hecho de mucha ayuda el préstamo anterior porque le permito crecer y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar, han cambiado la situacion familiar, aumento en el negocio y viven mejor que antes.
texts.en:
Omar is seeking a new loan as he wishes to invest more money in his business and increase earnings. The loan will enable him to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide etc for his fields.

The previous loan helped him greatly as he was able to expand his business and have everything he needed for his work. He was able to improve his family situation, expand his business, and have a better life than he had before.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide etc.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, tiene 28 años de edad, está soltero, vive con sus padres y cultiva el maíz, también tiene ganado, con estas ocupaciones ayuda a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, tiene 5 años de trabajar en esta actividad, aprendió desde pequeño ya que sus padres se dedicaban al mismo negocio.
Él se comprara abono, herbicidas, foliares para iniciar el cultivo de maíz también quiere comprarse concentrado para el ganado, está solicitando un préstamo, para poder llevar a cabo la compra, teniendo lo suficiente para mejorar la producción en las tierras.
Con la inversión él espera fortalecer el trabajo, mejorar su economía a través de la buena administración, que esto también mejore su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
José works growing basic grains. He is 28 years old, single, and lives with his parents. 

He grows corn, and also has livestock. With these occupations he helps his parents with the household expenses. He has been doing this work for five years. He learned when he was young because his parents worked in the same field.

He is buying fertilizer, herbicides, and foliar in order to start cultivating the corn and also he wants to buy animal feed for the livestock. He is asking for a loan in order to go through with the purchase, having enough to improve production of the land.

With the investment he hopes to reinforce the work, improving their finances through good management, and this will also improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, foliar, and animal feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Doris Yolanda

texts.es:
Doña Doris tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada, tiene  un hijo y vive con su familia en una aldea de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Doris tiene una gran habilidad para hacer productos de repostería. Emprendió su propio negocio con esfuerzos propios, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad donde labora diferentes tipos de productos como, pasteles, pizza, pan casero y otros productos elaborados con harina. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa y es vendido en la comunidad y por pedidos.  Este negocio  lo ha hecho crecer con la ayuda de los préstamos, los que le han permitido obtener ingresos necesarios para el hogar.
Actualmente esta solicitando su noveno préstamo, el cual lo invertirá en materia prima como harina, cajas de leche, azúcar, queso, y otros, para seguir manteniendo la demanda de clientes. 
Su meta es ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Doris is 35-years old.  She is married and has one son.  She and her family live in the small town of Taulabe, Comayagua.
Doris has a great ability for making baked goods.  She started her business on her own and for four years has been making different types of products.  She makes pastries, pizza, home-made bread and other flour-based products.  She has the business set up in her house and sells in her community and also takes orders.  She has grown her business with the help of the loans, which have allowed her to earn the money her household needs. 
Doris is currently requesting her ninth loan, which she will invest in raw materials like flour, boxes of milk, sugar, cheese and other items she needs to meet her customers' demands. 
Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, boxes of milk, sugar and other products for making her baked goods.

loans.name: Nurzada

texts.ru: Нурзаде 29 лет, троих замечательных девочек. Нурзада имеет высшее образование в области Истории, после окончания университета Нурзад начала свою трудовую деятельность в школе преподавательницей истории. Нурзада в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 7 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 12,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Нурзады в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 теленок, 10 овец, 1 лошадь. Нурзада ежегодно обрабатывает 0,5 га земли, в основном они с мужем выращивают фасоль,  перепродажа скота и полеводство приносит около 150,000 сом ежегодного дохода. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурзада обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы с теленком для продажи молока  и корма на остаток средств. Доходы от кредита Нурзада будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.Нурзада планирует построить дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Nurzada is 29 years old and has three wonderful girls.  After finishing university with a degree in history, she started a career as a history teacher. However, the main source of the income for her family has been her livestock business which she has run for 7 years.  She started this business with 12,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, today she has 1 calf, 10 sheep and 1 horse.  Nurzada also farms a half hectare of land with her husband where they grow beans.  Each year, the family earns around 150,000 KGS from their crop and reselling livestock.  With the goal of further developing her business, Nurzada has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 KGS to buy one cow from which she will harvest milk to sell, as well as feed for her other animals.  The income from the loan will be put back into the business.  Nurzada plans to build a home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase 1 milk cow and fodder for cattle

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 27 years old.

Ali owns a blacksmith's shop. He specializes in making doors and windows. He has been in this field since his childhood, and after gaining all the experience needed, Ali started to rely on himself and established his own business in 2011. Thanks to his positive behavior with his clients, Ali’s fame grew fast in his neighborhood and he has attracted many customers to him.

Ali is requesting a $2,500 youth loan. He will use this loan to buy a new diesel generator. This generator will help him to increase his production which will increase his revenues. He aims to improve his current economical conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new diesel generator.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina earns her income through her sari-sari or variety store. She has been doing the business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income.

Catalina is requesting a loan to buy additional stocks for her store like rice, soda, shampoo and toiletries, cooking ingredients, and canned goods. With this, she will be able to attract more buyers, thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her store like rice, soda, shampoo and toiletries, cooking ingredients, and canned goods

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng, 29, has a common law relationship with his spouse and has two dependent children. He has managed his own farm for over five years. Heng just completed elementary level at school, and he learned to operate this business from his parents. Due to owning a small sized piece of land for farming, Heng can hardly cover his daily costs and provide for his family's basic necessities. Heng is eager to improve his business and boost his household income. With this purpose, Heng is requesting a loan amount of $1,000 USD to buy a piece of farmland to expand the area of growing rice during the rainy season. In this way, he hopes to have a plentiful harvest and be able to improve his family's living conditions.  In the near future, Heng dreams of having enough farming supplies such as water pumps, plowing machines and others.

loans.use: to buy a piece of farmland in order to expand his growing rice area during the rainy season.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en: Evelina is 36 years old and married with 6 children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing and selling clothes in her community. She has 4 years of experience in this line of business. Evelina needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine and materials. She hopes to use her profits to pay her children's school fees and to help her business in the future. She joined SPBD in2009.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, fabric, new materials and needles.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud is an Iraqi youth client 29 years of age, married and a father of 2 children. Mahmud is the only provider in his family.

Mahmud is a grocer and owns a small grocery store, in which he sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, as well as snack foods. He established his business in 2006. Throughout his years of work, he gained good experience in what he does.

Mahmud is requesting a youth loan in the sum of $2,400 USD.  He will use this loan to buy a new motor generator and to install an external ceiling for his grocery store. In the future, Mahmud is aiming to improve his current financial conditions by expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy a new motor generator and to install an external ceiling for his grocery store

loans.name: Kadzo's Group

texts.en: Kadzo is a twenty-six year old mother of five children and a dry-land farmer. Her husband is also a farmer, and their agricultural endeavors face the challenges of low rainfall and lack of capital to invest in quality inputs. All five of Kadzo's children are currently in school and she intends to use the profits from her tree farm to continue educating her children.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Range Group

texts.en:
EUFRASIA, who is in her late 40s is married and has four children, three boys and one girl.  She has been frying and selling fish for three years now.  She works from 7:00 am to 12.00 noon daily (works for 5 hours) and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be EUFRASIA's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more fish and cooking oil and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to complete building her house and pay school fees and household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy more fish. She dreams of owning a big Restaurant.

EUFRASIA will share this loan with her loan group "RANGE" with ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Esilda

texts.es: Esilda de 38 años de edad es una mujer casada y madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 3,8 y 9 años. En su propia vivienda tiene un congelador donde almacena productos alimenticios congelados, especialmente derivados de la harina de trigo. Así mismo vende mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos a través de los cuales ofrece mercancías variadas, como cosméticos, perfumería, bisutería etc. Su negocio nació desde hace 7 años, cuando observando a una promotora quiso seguir su ejemplo y así lo hizo sin aun haberse detenido, pues con ello ayuda a su esposo en el sustento del hogar y genera mas bienestar para todos. En su negocio vende de contado y a crédito y sus principales proveedores son las multinacionales y como productora también prepara deditos, empanadas y otros productos derivados de la harina de trigo, que prepara y vende especialmente para cuando se realicen los diferentes eventos y festividades. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprara cosméticos bisutería y harina de trigo por bulto para aumentar su producción y responder a su clientela que cada día crece y hace que su negocio también se expanda.
texts.en:
Esilda, 38, is a married woman mother of three children who are 3, 8 and 9 years old.  She has a freezer at home where she stores frozen food items, especially those derived from wheat flour.  She also sells merchandise via catalog.  She sells a variety of goods like cosmetics, perfume, costume jewelry, etc.  Her business was born seven years ago when she observed a sales promoter and she decided to follow her example.  She did so and hasn’t stopped since because she helps her husband support their home this way and generates more well-being for all of them.

She sells for cash and on credit and her main suppliers are multinationals.   As a producer, she makes ‘deditos’ [ladyfingers], turnovers and other things made from wheat flour.  She makes them and sells them especially during various events and festivities.  

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy cosmetics, costume jewelry and wheat flour in bulk to increase production and meet customer demand that’s growing more each day causing her business to expand as well.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, costume jewelry and wheat flour in bulk.

loans.name: Dorys Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dorys, tiene una tienda la cual  les ayuda para sobrevivir. Los productos que venden son  de consumo básico, bebidas, gas, etc. Ella vive con su madre y su hija, tambien tiene familiares en el extranjero, pero no le ayudan mucho. El negocio inicio hace 3 años, lo cual ella lo administra con su hija, la ventaja que tienen es la buena clientela y sobre todo estabilidad. El préstamo lo invertirá en compra de suministros para la tienda como gas propano, arroz, frijoles, comidas enlatadas y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes muchos más productos.
La inversión le ayudara en gran medida a tener un mejor inventario para ofrecer a sus clientes, hará más rentable la tienda porque los beneficiados se sentirán más atraídos con nuevos productos. Su sueño es hacer de esta un minisúper asi como poder ayudarle a su hija en la educación.
texts.en:
Dorys runs a store so she can earn money to buy daily necessities. She sells everyday products such as drinks, gas etc. She lives with her mother and daughter; she has other family members living overseas but they don’t help her much. 

Dorys opened her business three years ago and she runs it with help from her daughter. Her great advantage is that she has a good customer base and stability above all. She plans to use the loan money to add stock to her store such as propane, rice, beans, and canned goods so she will have many more products to offer her customers.

The investment will help her a great deal as she will have a wider choice of items which, in turn, will lead to a more profitable store. Her customers will be attracted to the new products. Dorys’s dream is turn the store into a mini-supermarket so that she’ll be able to help her daughter with educational expenses.

loans.use: buy propane, rice, beans, and canned goods

loans.name: Hien's Group

texts.en:
Hien was born in 1958. She has two children who are adults and they have their own family. Her husband is a farmer. His income is about 5,000,000 VND. Hien grows rice and raises chickens, ducks and pigs to earn a living. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2013. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy food to feed her poultry and pigs. She also wants to use the money to buy poultry’ seeds to raise. 

 Huong is 41 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to raise chickens.

 Le is 45 years old. She has three children, She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy food to feed the poultry and pigs

loans.name: Henry Oswaldo

texts.es:
HENRY  tiene 35 años de edad es casado tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y con la hija en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

HENRY es Chofer Profesional. Solicita el crédito para comprar una refrigeradora. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que tanta falta le hace en el hogar. La compra la realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda. El sueño es mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia y tener una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es luchar contra cualquier problema que se presente. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar y pasar con la familia.
texts.en: HENRY OSWALDO, who is 35 and married with one daughter, works as a professional driver.  He, his wife and their daughter live in Chimbo in Bolívar Province.  He is applying for a loan to buy a refrigerator which he greatly needs in his home and will go to the city of Guaranda to buy it.  His ambition is to improve his family's lifestyle and to own his own home.  He has to deal with any problem which life throws at him.  In his free time, he likes playing and spending time with his family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Eddys  Antonio

texts.es:
Eddys, un joven con deseo de superación,  de 23 años de edad,  originario de Granada, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de artículos  plásticos, del que es propietario hace más de 4 años. Desde muy joven inicio a trabajar en el comercio  pues su padre le enseño a ganarse la vida desde niño, fue creciendo  y aprendiendo a ser un hombre independiente y generar recursos por si solo, luego su papa decidió viajar a Costa Rica a vender otros productos con el objetivo de obtener otros ingresos extras, Eddys se siente muy satisfecho porque ha logrado incrementar sus ventas poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo,  y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias, sus productos los comercializa  en otros Departamentos como Diriomo.
Sus expectativas es poder ampliar su negocio. El esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar  panas plásticas, baldes, vasos plásticos y al mismo tiempo quiere comprar calzado como zapatos, chinelas,  sandalias, etc.  Con el objetivo de diversificar un poco más su negocio, y poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, dentro de sus planes futuros es hacer crecer su negocio con productos que aun no tiene en inventario.
texts.en:
Eddys, 23, is a young man who wants to improve himself.  He's from Granada and a merchant by trade.  He makes a living selling plastic items; he has owned the business for more than four years.

He started to work in commerce at a very young age because his father taught him to earn a living.  He grew up and learned to be an independent man and generate resources on his own.  His father decided to go to Costa Rica to sell other products so he could earn extra income.

Eddys is satisfied because he has managed to increase his sales little by little with a lot of effort, earning more profit.  He sells his products in other departments, such as Diriomo.  He hopes to expand his business.

He needs the loan to buy plastic bowls, buckets, and cups.  He also wants to buy footwear such as shoes, slippers, sandals, etc.

One of his plans for the future is to make his business grow with products he doesn't yet stock so he can diversify a little and be able to satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy footwear and plastic bowls, buckets, and cups

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es: Gilda, de 49 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, está casada  con Lucio con quien tiene 3 hijos de 26, 23 y 21 años de edad respectivamente .Ella vive junto a su familia en una casa de material noble , la cual fue construida con el fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación .La actividad que realiza Gilda es la venta de comidas, razón por la cual tiene un pequeño en local en su hogar, en donde puso las mesas y sillas necesarias para atender cómodamente a sus clientes, quienes se sienten satisfechos de la buena atención que reciben. También realiza la costura de ropas interiores por las tardes .Se inició  hace más de 6 años en el negocio de las comidas y a su vez cuenta con una mesera ya que necesita ayuda para atender a los clientes. En un futuro espera hacer crecer su negocio, mejorar sus ambientes y variar sus platillos, además de poner una tienda de verduras en el frontis de su casa.Este es el préstamo número 04 con Kiva, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual .Con el monto solicitado de S/. 1500 nuevos soles comprara ingredientes para la preparación de comidas, como arroz, aceites, menestras y demás, buscando menores precios para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Gilda, 49, is a hard working and enterprising women. She is married to Lucio with whom she has three children aged 26, 23, and 21 respectively. She lives together with her family in a quality-built home which was constructed as a result of their effort and dedication. Gilda's activity is food sales; it's the reason why she has a small place in her home where she placed the tables and chairs necessary to comfortably attend to her customers who are satisfied with the good service that they receive. She also sews underwear in the evenings. She began working in the food business 6 years ago and at the same time she has a server since she needs help attending to the customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business, improve her surroundings, and vary her dishes, as well as opening a produce shop in the front of her home.

This is her fourth loan with Kiva. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity to rely on a line of credit to be able to advance her business; that's why she is committed to fulfill her installment payments punctually. With the requested amount of S/.1500 [Peruvian Nuevo Sol], she will buy ingredients for food preparation such as rice, oils, vegetable stews, and other things, searching for low prices to obtain greater profit.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Silvia es una sencilla comerciante, 41 años de edad, habitante de Granada, casada, madre de 2 hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad respectivamente. Inicio su actividad laboral a la edad de 20 años, trabajando con su esposo en  el taller de carpintería, elaborando muebles para salir a vender a otros Departamento, ya que ellos se vieron en la obligación de trabajar los dos en el taller porque necesitaban el dinero para sobrevivir junto con su familia, ya que uno de sus  hijo es descapacitado. Con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo han podido salir adelante con las ganancias que le genera este negocios , ella cuenta con otros ingresos como es el dinero que le pagan por el cuido de un anciano, es así que Silvia lucha cada día por generar ingresos extras.
Silvia esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar  maderas, sener, lija, pega, pintura, barniz, etc.  Ella estima que este préstamo le ayudara a comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus muebles, con el objetivo de cumplir con los encargos que le hacen sus clientes  y mantener más sólido su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia, 41, is a simple tradeswoman. She is originally from Granada and is married with two children, ages 14 and 17. 

She started her business at the age of 20, working with her husband in a carpentry workshop. They made furniture to sell in other provinces. They felt the obligation for both of them to work, since they needed money to survive along with their family because one of their children is disabled. 

With plenty of effort and arduous work, they have managed to succeed with the earnings that this business generates. Silvia has another source of income, which is the money that she is paid to care for an elderly person. She fights every day to earn an extra income. 

Silvia needs this loan to buy wood, paint thinner, sandpaper, glue, paint, varnish, etc. She believes that this loan will help her to buy all of the raw materials that she needs to make furniture, with the goal of fulfilling the orders from her clients and maintaining a more solid business.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint thinner, sandpaper, glue, paint, and varnish.

loans.name: Samson's Group

texts.en: Samson is a seventy-one year old father of seven and a widower. He is a dryland farmer but lacks the capital for fertilizers and his crops suffer from drought. Samson intends to use his profits from his KOMAZA tree farm to develop his agriculture by buying more land and better inputs.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is an industrious mother and wife. She is 48 years old and has been three years operating her buy and sell business. Within these years of selling fish, she has taken care of her children's needs such as allowances. To achieve greater income, she is requesting for a loan amount PHP 5,000 to buy more fish and shrimp to resell.

loans.use: to buy more fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, de 58 años, es una mujer alegre y muy responsable, esta casada con José con quien tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes. Vive cómodamente en su casa propia casa junto a su esposo.El trabajo de Mary consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, así como la restauración de prendas de sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, cuando necesitan que les hagan una ropa nueva no dudan en ir a casa de ella para pedirle que les haga la costura deseada, es muy buena haciendo su trabajo, lleva en el negocio mas 20 años, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes y siempre tiene pedidos, trabaja sola pero cuando tiene grandes pedidos contrata a otras personas a quienes paga por sus servicios eventuales. Decidió poner su negocio porque  quería dar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos y el dinero que ganaba su pareja no alcanzaba para los gastos básicos del hogar. Espera en el futuro poder comprar mas maquinas y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.Este será el préstamo numero 04 con Kiva, esta muy contenta de poder acceder a los prestamos ya que le son de mucha ayuda para poder tener mayor capital de trabajo.Con el monto solicitado de 2000 soles, comprará más materiales para la costura, entre ellas; telas, algodón, hilos y mas materiales necesarios.
texts.en:
Mary, 58, is a friendly and very responsible woman. She is married to José, with whom she has two children who are already independent. She lives comfortably in her own house with her husband. 

Mary's work consists of cutting and making items of clothing, as well as repairing clothing for her friends, neighbors, and relatives. When they need someone to make them new clothing, they don't hesitate to go to her house to ask her to carry out the sewing that they require. 

She is very good at her work and she has had this business for 20 years. Therefore, she has many clients and she always has orders. She works alone, but when she has large orders she hires other people who she pays for their services. She decided to open her business because she wanted to give a good quality of life to her children, and the money her husband earns did not cover their basic home expenses. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy more machines and offer her clients a better service. This will be her fourth loan with Kiva. She is very happy to have access to these loans, because they are of great help to her in increasing her working capital. With the requested amount of 2000 Peruvian soles, she will buy more sewing materials, such as fabric, cotton, thread, and other necessary materials.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as fabric and needles, among others.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: To help her parents earn a living, 18-year-old Esmeralda has operated a dried fish selling business. She earns a maximum of 200 PHP each day from the business, which is a great help in their everyday living. She wants to earn more for the improvement of their poor living conditions. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional capital to purchase dried fish.  She hopes to further grow her business and to increase her income, which will secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Amarjargal is a 37-year-old widow, who lives with her mother, a sibling and 2 children in Ger in the Bayanhongor Province of Mongolia. Her mother is retired and stays home. Her sibling herds livestock, and her children Adiyanyam, age 15, and Erdene-Ochir, age 12, go to local schools. 

The borrower has been working for various industries previously, and she is now starting her own taxi service business in town. She is requesting 850,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and get her existing car fixed in order to start her taxi service business in town. She is a hardworking, open-minded and modest woman, who has a dream of opening a small grocery store near her home.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and get her existing car fixed in order to start her taxi service business in town

loans.name: Eka

texts.en: Eka is 37 years old. She lives in a small village in the Tkibuli district, West Georgia with her mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig and 2 milk cows. Eka and her mother milk cows and produce cheese products to sell at local markets. Additionally, they have a vineyard and sell wine. Eka requested a loan for renovating a house. After the house is renovated they will be able to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a house

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer, 38, is married. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. He also raises sheep for meat purposes. Azer has 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best how to look after cattle. 

Azer usually buys small cattle then raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. He sells milk and yoghurt to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings 80 AZN in income per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. 

This is only one financial income in his family--not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Azer applied for a loan of 1800 AZN to purchase three cattle, two milk cows and fodder. He has already had several loans with AqroInvest and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy three cattle, two milk cows and fodder.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda es una mujer con 36 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante madre soltera con 2 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella y ambos estudian. El mayor de 18 años esta en segundo nivel de secundaria y el menor de 14 años cursa el segundo de ciclo común al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles ayudan a su madre con las actividades del campo como ser: limpiar, abonar, fumigar y cortar la cosecha. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación debido a que sus padres son de bajos recursos económicos y no pudieron ayudarle con sus estudios. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado al cultivo de café actividad practicada por su familia hasta hoy en día siendo este el único sustento ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra hace mas de 15 años. La tierra que trabajan en familia fue heredada por sus padres hace un tiempo para cubrir gastos como la alimentación, vestimenta, estudio, medicinas, etc. La cual esta ubicada a 4.5 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.  

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café esto para que sea una cosecha sana y provechosa para poder generar ingresos, obtener ganancias y poder seguir invirtiendo en la misma.

Sus sueños son de poder ver a sus 2 hijos graduados a un nivel universitario ya que de esa forma ellos podrán tener un mejor estilo de vida, un mejor futuro, una mejor educación y puedan heredar la tierra que hoy en día trabajan para que puedan seguir sacando provecho de ella y esta pueda pasar de generación en generación.
texts.en:
Leonarda, 36, is a fighting, enterprising woman with a desire to get overcome and succeed. She is a single mother with two children who depend on her financially, both of whom are studying. Her older child is 18 and is in the second level of secondary school, and her younger child is 14 and is in the second grade of middle school. After they get out of school, they help their mother with the farm labor, such as cleaning, spreading manure, fumigating, and cutting the crops. 

She does not have any educational degree, due to the fact that her parents had a low income and were unable to help her with her studies. From childhood she has made a living by cultivating coffee, which is what her family has done to this day.
